text: Happy is the man who does not walk in the way sinful men tell him to, or stand in the path of sinners, or sit with those who laugh at the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he finds joy in the Law of the Lord and thinks about His Law day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man is like a tree planted by rivers of water, which gives its fruit at the right time and its leaf never dries up. Whatever he does will work out well for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sinful men are not like this. They are like straw blown away by the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sinful will not stand. They will be told they are guilty and have to suffer for it. Sinners will not stand with those who are right with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord knows the way of those who are right with Him. But the way of the sinful will be lost from God forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why are the nations so shaken up and the people planning foolish things?
speaker: Narrator

text: The kings of the earth stand in a line ready to fight, and all the leaders are against the Lord and against His Chosen One.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say, “Let us break their chains and throw them away from us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He Who sits in the heavens laughs. The Lord makes fun of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He will speak to them in His anger and make them afraid, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “But as for Me, I have set My King on Zion, My holy mountain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make known the words of the Lord. He said to Me, “You are My Son. Today I have become Your Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask of Me, and I will give the nations for you to own. The ends of the earth will belong to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will break them using a piece of iron. And they will be broken in pieces like pots of clay.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So, kings, be wise. Listen, you rulers of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serve the Lord with fear, and be full of joy as you shake in fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kiss the Son. Be afraid that He may be angry and destroy you in the way. For His anger is quick. Happy are all who put their trust in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, how many are they who hate me! How many rise up against me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are saying of me, “There is no help for him in God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But You, O Lord, are a covering around me, my shining-greatness, and the One Who lifts my head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was crying to the Lord with my voice. And He answered me from His holy mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: I lay down and slept, and I woke up again, for the Lord keeps me safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people who stand all around against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, O Lord! Save me, O my God! For You have hit on the face all those who hate me, and you have broken the teeth of the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is You Who saves, O Lord. May You bring happiness to Your people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Answer me when I call, O my God Who is right and good! You have made a way for me when I needed help. Be kind to me, and hear my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: O sons of men, how long will you turn my honor into shame? How long will you love what is of no use, and run after lies?
speaker: Narrator

text: Know that the Lord has set apart him who is God-like for Himself. The Lord hears when I call to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shake with anger and do not sin. When you are on your bed, look into your hearts and be quiet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give the gifts that are right and good, and trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are asking, “Who will show us any good?” Let the light of Your face shine on us, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have filled my heart with more happiness than they have when there is much grain and wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lie down and sleep in peace. O Lord, You alone keep me safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my words, O Lord. Think about my crying.
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen to my cry for help, my King and my God. For I pray to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning, O Lord, You will hear my voice. In the morning I will lay my prayers before You and will look up.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not a God Who is pleased with what is bad. The sinful cannot be with You.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud cannot stand before You. You hate all who do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: You destroy those who tell lies. The Lord hates liars and men who kill other people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, by Your great loving-kindness, I will come into Your house. At Your holy house I will put my face to the ground before You in love and fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, lead me in what is right and good, because of the ones who hate me. Make Your way straight in front of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in their talk there is no truth. Their hearts destroy. Their mouths are like an open grave. With their tongues, they say sweet-sounding words that are not true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hold them guilty, O God! Let them fall by their own plans. Throw them out because of their many sins. For they have fought against You.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let all who put their trust in You be glad. Let them sing with joy forever. You make a covering for them, that all who love Your name may be glad in You.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You will make those happy who do what is right, O Lord. You will cover them all around with Your favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, do not speak sharp words to me in Your anger, or punish me when You are angry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be kind to me, O Lord, for I am weak. O Lord, heal me for my bones are shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is in great suffering. But You, O Lord, how long?
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, O Lord. Set my soul free. Save me because of Your loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one remembers You when he is dead. Who gives You praise from the grave?
speaker: Narrator

text: I am tired of crying inside myself. All night long my pillow is wet with tears. I flood my bed with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eye has grown weak with sorrow. It has grown old because of all who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go away from me, all you who sin. For the Lord has heard the sound of my crying.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has heard my cry for help. The Lord receives my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those who hate me will be ashamed and worried. They will turn away. They will be put to shame right away.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, in You I have put my trust. Save me from all those who come for me, and keep me safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or they will tear me like a lion, carrying me away where there is no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, if I have done this, and there is guilt on my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: if I have done wrong to him who was at peace with me, or without a reason have robbed him who worked against me,
speaker: Narrator

text: let him who hates me come for me and catch me. Let him break me under his feet until I die, and lay my honor in the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up in Your anger, O Lord. Rise up against the anger of those who hate me. Awake, my God, and help me. Prove what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the people gather around You, and rule over them from Your throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord judge which people are guilty or not. O Lord, judge in my favor if I am right with You, and if I am without blame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sins of the sinful stop. But build up those who are right with You. For the God Who is right and good tests both the hearts and the minds.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am kept safe by God, Who saves those who are pure in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is always right in how He judges. He is angry with the sinful every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man is not sorry for his sins and will not turn from them, God will make His sword sharp. He will string His bow and make it ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: He takes up His sword and the bow of death. And He makes arrows of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: See how the sinful man thinks up sins and plans trouble and lies start growing inside him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has dug out a deep hole, and has fallen into the hole he has dug.
speaker: Narrator

text: The trouble he makes will return to him. When he hurts others it will come down on his own head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give thanks to the Lord because He is right and good. I will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, our Lord, how great is Your name in all the earth. You have set Your shining-greatness above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the mouth of children and babies, You have built up strength because of those who hate You, and to quiet those who fight against You.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I look up and think about Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, the moon and the stars, which You have set in their place,
speaker: Narrator

text: what is man, that You think of him, the son of man that You care for him?
speaker: Narrator

text: You made him a little less than the angels and gave him a crown of greatness and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: You made him to rule over the works of Your hands. You put all things under his feet:
speaker: Narrator

text: All sheep and cattle, all the wild animals,
speaker: Narrator

text: the birds of the air, and the fish of the sea, and all that pass through the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, our Lord, how great is Your name in all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give thanks to the Lord with all my heart. I will tell of all the great things You have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad and full of joy because of You. I will sing praise to Your name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: When those who hate me turn away, they fall and are lost from You.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You have stood by my right actions. You sit on Your throne, and are right in how You judge.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have spoken sharp words to the nations and have destroyed the sinful. You have thrown out their name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who fight against You are finished forever. You have destroyed their cities. They will be remembered no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord lives forever. He has set up His throne to say who is guilty or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will punish the world by what is right. He will be fair as He rules the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also keeps safe those who suffer. He is a safe place in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who know Your name will put their trust in You. For You, O Lord, have never left alone those who look for You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises to the Lord, Who lives in Zion! Tell all the nations what He has done!
speaker: Narrator

text: For He Who punishes for the blood of another remembers them. He does not forget the cry of those who suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have pity on me, O Lord! See how I suffer from those who hate me, You Who have lifted me up from the gates of death,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may tell of all Your praises in the gates of the people of Zion. There I will be full of joy because You save.
speaker: Narrator

text: The nations have fallen into the hole they have dug. Their own feet have been caught in the net they have hidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has made Himself known. He is fair in His Law. The sinful trap themselves by the work of their own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful, all the nations that forget God, will be turned back into the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those in need will not always be forgotten. The hope of the poor will not be lost forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, O Lord! Do not let man win the fight against You. Let the nations come to You and be judged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make them afraid, O Lord. Let the nations know they are only men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do You stand far away, O Lord? Why do You hide Yourself in times of trouble?
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful, in their pride, try to catch the weak. Let them be caught in the plans they have made.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful man is proud of the desires of his heart. He praises those who want everything but he speaks against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful man in his pride does not look for God. All his thoughts are that there is no God.
speaker: Narrator

text: His ways always go well for him. Your laws are too high for him to see. He laughs at those who hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He says to himself, “I will not be moved. For all time, I will never have trouble.”
speaker: Narrator

text: With his mouth he swears and lies. He makes it hard for other people. Trouble and sin are under his tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lies hidden in the towns, waiting to kill those who are not guilty. His eyes are always watching for the weak.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lies in wait like a hidden lion. He lies in wait to catch the weak, and they become caught in his net.
speaker: Narrator

text: The weak are hurt and they fall. They cannot stand under his strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: He says to himself, “God has forgotten. He has hidden His face and will never see it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, O Lord! Lift up Your hand, O God. Do not forget the weak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why does the sinful man turn away from God? He has said to himself, “You will not ask it of me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But You have seen it. You look upon trouble and suffering, to take it into Your hands. The suffering man gives himself to You. You are the Helper of the one who has no father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Break the arm of the bad and sinful man. Find out all his sins until You find no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is King forever and ever. Those who worship false gods will be taken from the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, You have heard the prayers of those who have no pride. You will give strength to their heart, and You will listen to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way, You will do the right thing for those without a father and those who suffer, so that man who is of the earth will no longer make them afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the Lord I am safe. How can you say to me, “Fly away as a bird to your mountain?
speaker: Narrator

text: For look, the sinful raise their bow. They make their arrow ready on the string to shoot in the dark against the pure in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the base of the building is destroyed, what can those who are right with God do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is in His holy house. The Lord’s throne is in heaven. His eyes see as He tests the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord tests and proves those who are right and good and those who are sinful. And His soul hates the one who loves to hurt others.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will send down fire upon the sinful. Fire and sulphur and burning wind will be the cup they will drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is right and good. He loves what is right and good. And those who are right with Him will see His face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help, Lord! For God-like men are here no more. The faithful can no longer be seen among the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lie to each other. Their lips speak with sweet-sounding words that are not true.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord cut off all lips of false respect, and the tongue that speaks of great things.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say, “We can win with our tongues. Our lips are our own. Who is lord over us?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Because of the suffering of the weak, and because of the cries of the poor, I will now rise up,” says the Lord. “I will keep him safe as he has wanted to be.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of the Lord are pure words. They are like silver that has been made pure seven times in a stove of earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, You will keep us. You will keep us safe forever from the people of this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful walk on every side when bad actions are held in honor among the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long, O Lord? Will You forget me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: How long must I plan what to do in my soul, and have sorrow in my heart all the day? How long will those who hate me rise above me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Look on me and answer, O Lord, my God. Give light to my eyes, or I will sleep the sleep of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or the one who hates me will say, “I have power over him.” And those who hate me will be happy when I am shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have trusted in Your loving-kindness. My heart will be full of joy because You will save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing to the Lord, because He has been good to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” They are sinful and their actions are sinful. There is no one who does good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has looked down from heaven on the sons of men, to see if there are any who understand and look for God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have all turned aside. Together they have become bad. There is no one who does good, not even one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will those who sin never learn? They eat up my people like they eat bread. They do not call on the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they are in much fear. For God is with the people of this day who do what is right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: You would put to shame the planning of the poor. But the Lord keeps him safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: O, that it would come out of Zion that Israel would be saved! When the Lord returns His people to their land, Jacob will be full of joy and Israel will be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, who may live in Your tent? Who may live on Your holy hill?
speaker: Narrator

text: He who walks without blame and does what is right and good, and speaks the truth in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: He does not hurt others with his tongue, or do wrong to his neighbor, or bring shame to his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: He looks down upon a sinful person, but honors those who fear the Lord. He keeps his promises even if it may hurt him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives money to be used without being paid for its use. And he does not take money to hurt those who are not guilty. He who does these things will never be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me, O God, for I am safe in You.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said to the Lord, “You are my Lord. All the good things I have come from You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As for those in the land who belong to You, they are the great ones in whom is all my joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who have traded for another god bring many troubles on themselves. I will not take part in their altar gifts of blood. And I will not take their names upon my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is all that I am to receive, and my cup. My future is in Your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land given to me is good. Yes, my share is beautiful to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give honor and thanks to the Lord, Who has told me what to do. Yes, even at night my mind teaches me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have placed the Lord always in front of me. Because He is at my right hand, I will not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so my heart is glad. My soul is full of joy. My body also will rest without fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You will not give me over to the grave. And You will not allow Your Holy One to return to dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will show me the way of life. Being with You is to be full of joy. In Your right hand there is happiness forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear what is right, O Lord. Listen to my cry. Hear my prayer, for it does not come from lying lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: May You decide in my favor. May Your eyes see what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have tested my heart. You have visited me during the night. You have tested me and have found nothing wrong. I have decided that my mouth will not sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the actions of men, by the word of Your lips, I have kept myself from the paths of those who want to hurt others.
speaker: Narrator

text: My steps have followed Your paths. My feet have not turned from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have called to You, O God, for You will answer me. Listen to me and hear my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show Your great loving-kindness. You save by Your right hand the people that come to You for help from those who hate them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me safe as You would Your own eye. Hide me in the shadow of Your wings,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the sinful who fight against me, those who would kill me and are all around me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have closed their fat hearts to pity. And their mouths speak with pride.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have followed our every step and are all around us. They are watching for a way to bring us down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is like a hungry lion, like a young lion hiding and waiting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, O Lord. Stand against him. Bring him down. Save me from the sinful with Your sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, save me by Your hand from such men. Their riches are in this life. Their stomach is filled with what you have stored for them. Their children are filled. Let them leave some for their babies.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, I will see Your face in what is right and good. I will be happy to see You when I awake.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love You, O Lord, my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my rock, and my safe place, and the One Who takes me out of trouble. My God is my rock, in Whom I am safe. He is my safe-covering, my saving strength, and my strong tower.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call to the Lord, Who has the right to be praised. And I am saved from those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ropes of death were all around me. The floods of death make me afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ropes of the grave were all around me. The traps of death were set for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I called to the Lord in my trouble. I cried to God for help. He heard my voice from His holy house. My cry for help came into His ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the earth shook. The mountains were shaking. They shook because He was angry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Smoke went out from His nose and the fire that kept coming from His mouth burned everything around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He parted the heavens and came down. Dark clouds were under His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sat upon a cherub and flew. He traveled on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made darkness His hiding place, the covering around Him, the dark rain clouds of the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through the light before Him passed His dark clouds, hail stones and fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord made thunder in the heavens. The voice of the Most High spoke out, hail stones and fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent out His arrows and divided them. He threw down lightning and sent them running.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the deep part of the sea could be seen. And the deep part of the earth was opened up, because of Your sharp words, O Lord, because of the powerful breath from Your nose.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent from above, and took me. He lifted me out of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took me away from the powerful one who fights against me, and from those who hated me. They were too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stood against me in the day of my trouble. But the Lord was my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me out into a big place. He gave me a safe place, because He was pleased with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has paid me because of my being right with Him. Because of my clean hands He has paid me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have kept the ways of the Lord. And I have not sinned by turning from my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All His Laws are in front of me. I have not set His Laws aside.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before Him I was without blame. And I have kept myself from sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord has paid me back for being right with Him, and for my hands being clean in His eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the faithful, You show Yourself faithful. To those without blame, You show Yourself without blame.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the pure, You show Yourself pure. With the sinful You show Yourself to be against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You save those who are suffering, but You bring low those who have pride in their eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: You make my lamp bright. The Lord my God lights my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: With Your help I can go against many soldiers. With my God I can jump over a wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for God, His way is perfect. The Word of the Lord has stood the test. He is a covering for all who go to Him for a safe place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Who is God, but the Lord? And who is a rock except our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is God Who covers me with strength and makes my way perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes my feet like the feet of a deer. And He sets me on my high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: He teaches me how to fight, so that I can use a bow of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have also given me the covering that saves me. Your right hand holds me up. And Your care has made me great.
speaker: Narrator

text: You make the road wide for my steps, and my feet have not tripped.
speaker: Narrator

text: I went after those who fight against me, and caught them. And I did not return until they were destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hit them so they were not able to rise. They fell under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have given me strength for war. You have put under me those who have fought against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made them turn their backs to me also. And I destroyed those who hated me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried for help, but there was no one to save. They cried to the Lord, but He did not answer them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I beat them as small as the dust in the wind. I emptied them out like mud in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have taken me away from the fighting of the people. You have made me the leader of nations. People whom I have not known will serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as they hear, they obey me. Those from other lands obey me.
speaker: Narrator

text: These people from other lands lose their strength of heart. And they come shaking from behind their walls.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord lives! How great is my Rock! Praise be to the God Who saves me!
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the God Who punishes those who have done wrong to me. He puts nations under my rule.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saves me from those who hate me. Yes, You lift me above those who rise up against me. You save me from those who want to hurt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I will give thanks to You among the nations, O Lord. And I will sing praises to Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives His king great power over trouble. And He shows loving-kindness to His chosen one, to David, and to his children after him forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens are telling of the greatness of God and the great open spaces above show the work of His hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day to day they speak. And night to night they show much learning.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no speaking and no words where their voice is not heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sound has gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them He has placed a tent for the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is as a man soon to be married coming out of his room and as a strong man who is happy to run his race.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its rising is from one end of the heavens, and it makes its way to the other end. Nothing is hidden from its heat.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Law of the Lord is perfect, giving new strength to the soul. The Law He has made known is sure, making the child-like wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Laws of the Lord are right, giving joy to the heart. The Word of the Lord is pure, giving light to the eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the Lord is pure, lasting forever. The Lord is always true and right in how He judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Word of the Lord is worth more than gold, even more than much fine gold. They are sweeter than honey, even honey straight from the comb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by them Your servant is told to be careful. In obeying them there is great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can see his own mistakes? Forgive my sins that I do not see.
speaker: Narrator

text: And keep Your servant from sinning by going my own way. Do not let these sins rule over me. Then I will be without blame. And I will not be found guilty of big sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the words of my mouth and the thoughts of my heart be pleasing in Your eyes, O Lord, my Rock and the One Who saves me.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord answer you in the day of trouble! May the name of the God of Jacob keep you safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: May He send you help from the house of God, and give you strength from Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: May He remember all your gifts of grain given on the altar in worship. And may He be pleased with your burnt gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: May He give you the desire of your heart, and make all your plans go well.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will sing for joy when you win. In the name of our God we will lift up our flags. May the Lord give you all the things you ask Him for.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I know that the Lord saves His chosen one. He will answer him from His holy heaven, with the saving power of His right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some trust in wagons and some in horses. But we will trust in the name of the Lord, our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have fallen on their knees. But we rise up and stand straight.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, save! May the King answer us when we call.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, in Your strength the king is glad! How great is his joy in Your saving power!
speaker: Narrator

text: You have given him the desire of his heart. You have not kept from him anything that he has asked for.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You meet him with gifts of good things. You set a crown of pure gold on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked You for life and You gave it to him, a long life forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: His honor is great because of Your help. You have given him greatness and power.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have given him honor and respect forever. And You make him glad with the joy of being with You.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the king trusts in the Lord. Because of the loving-kindness of the Most High, he will not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your hand will find all who fight against You. Your right hand will find those who hate You.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will make them like a stove of fire in the time of Your anger. The Lord will eat them up in His anger. And the fire will destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will destroy their children from the earth, and their sons from the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they planned much trouble against You. They have made sinful plans that will come to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You will make them turn their backs when You take up Your bow against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be honored in Your strength, O Lord. We will sing and praise Your power.
speaker: Narrator

text: My God, my God, why have You left me alone? Why are You so far from helping me, and from the words I cry inside myself?
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, I cry during the day, but You do not answer. I cry during the night, but I find no rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet You are holy. The praises Israel gives You are Your throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers trusted in You, and You saved them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried to You and were set free. They trusted in You and were not ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am a worm and not a man. I am put to shame by men, and am hated by the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who see me make fun of me. They open their mouths and shake their heads, and say,
speaker: Narrator

text: “He trusts in the Lord. Let the Lord help him. Let the Lord take him out of trouble, because he is happy in Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But You brought me out when I was born. You made me trust when I drank my mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was in Your care from birth. Since my mother gave birth to me, You have been my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be far from me, for trouble is near. And there is no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many bulls have gathered all around me. Strong bulls of Bashan stand around me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They open their mouths wide against me, like a loud, hungry lion.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am poured out like water. And all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like a melted candle within me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My strength is dried up like a piece of a broken clay pot. My tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth. And You lay me in the dust of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For dogs have gathered around me. A group of sinful men stand around me. They have cut through my hands and feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can tell how many bones I have. The people look at me with wide eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: They divide my clothes among them by drawing names to see who would get them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You, O Lord, be not far from me! O my Strength, hurry to help me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Take me away from the sword. Save my life from the power of the dog.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me from the lion’s mouth, and from the horns of the wild bulls You answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make Your name known to my brothers. In the center of the meeting of worship I will praise You.
speaker: Narrator

text: You who fear the Lord, give Him praise. All you children of Jacob, honor Him. Fear Him, all you children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He has not turned away from the suffering of the one in pain or trouble. He has not hidden His face from him. But He has heard his cry for help.
speaker: Narrator

text: My praise will be from You in the big meeting of worship. I will keep my promises to Him in front of those who fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who suffer will eat and have enough. Those who look for the Lord will praise Him. May your heart live forever!
speaker: Narrator

text: All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the Lord. All the families of the nations will worship before Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the holy nation is the Lord’s, and He rules over the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the proud ones of the earth will eat and worship. All who go down to the dust will fall to their knees before Him, even he who cannot keep his soul alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Future children will serve Him. They will tell of the Lord to their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will come and tell about His saving power to a people yet to be born. For He has done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my Shepherd. I will have everything I need.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lets me rest in fields of green grass. He leads me beside the quiet waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes me strong again. He leads me in the way of living right with Himself which brings honor to His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, even if I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will not be afraid of anything, because You are with me. You have a walking stick with which to guide and one with which to help. These comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are making a table of food ready for me in front of those who hate me. You have poured oil on my head. I have everything I need.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure, You will give me goodness and loving-kindness all the days of my life. Then I will live with You in Your house forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth is the Lord’s, and all that is in it, the world, and all who live in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He has built it upon the seas. He has set it upon the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who may go up the mountain of the Lord? And who may stand in His holy place?
speaker: Narrator

text: He who has clean hands and a pure heart. He who has not lifted up his soul to what is not true, and has not made false promises.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will receive what is good from the Lord, and what is right and good from the God Who saves him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such is the family of those who look for Him, who look for Your face, O God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your heads, O gates. And be lifted up, O doors that last forever. And the King of shining-greatness will come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the King of shining-greatness? The Lord strong and powerful. The Lord powerful in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your heads, O gates. Lift them up, O doors that last forever and the King of shining-greatness will come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the King of shining-greatness? The Lord of All. He is the King of shining-greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I lift up my soul to You, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, I trust in You. Do not let me be ashamed. Do not let those who fight against me win.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, let no one who hopes in You be put to shame. But put to shame those who hurt others without a reason.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me Your ways, O Lord. Teach me Your paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lead me in Your truth and teach me. For You are the God Who saves me. I wait for You all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Your loving-pity and Your loving-kindness, O Lord. For they have been from old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not remember my sins from when I was young, or my sinful ways. By Your loving-kindness remember me for You are good, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good and right is the Lord. So He teaches sinners in His ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: He leads those without pride into what is right, and teaches them His way.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the paths of the Lord are loving and true for those who keep His agreement and keep His Laws.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the good of Your name, O Lord, forgive my sin, even as big as it is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the man who fears the Lord? He will teach him in the way he should choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: His soul will live a rich life. And his children will be given the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The secret of the Lord is for those who fear Him. And He will make them know His agreement.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes are always on the Lord. For He will take my feet out of the net.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn to me and show me Your loving-kindness. For I am alone and in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The troubles of my heart have grown. Bring me out of my suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon my troubles and my pain, and forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon those who hate me, for they are many. And how very much they hate me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me safe, Lord, and set me free. Do not let me be put to shame for I put my trust in You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let what is good and what is right keep me safe, because I wait for You.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, make Israel free from all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, stand by me for I have lived my life without blame. I have trusted in the Lord without changing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Test me and try me, O Lord. Test my mind and my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Your loving-kindness is always in front of my eyes. And I have walked in Your truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not sit with men who lie about the truth. I would not be seen with those who pretend to be someone they are not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate the meeting of sinners, and will not sit with the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will wash my hands of any guilt. And I will go around Your altar, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will speak with the voice of thanks, and tell of all Your great works.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I love the house where You live, the place where Your shining-greatness lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not take my soul away with sinners, or my life with men who kill other people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sinful plans are in their hands. And their right hand is full of pay for hurting others.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I will live a life without blame. Make me free, and show me loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: My foot stands on a good place. I will give honor to the Lord, in the meeting of worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my light and the One Who saves me. Whom should I fear? The Lord is the strength of my life. Of whom should I be afraid?
speaker: Narrator

text: When sinful men, and all who hated me, came against me to destroy my flesh, they tripped and fell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even if an army gathers against me, my heart will not be afraid. Even if war rises against me, I will be sure of You.
speaker: Narrator

text: One thing I have asked from the Lord, that I will look for: that I may live in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to look upon the beauty of the Lord, and to worship in His holy house.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the day of trouble He will keep me safe in His holy tent. In the secret place of His tent He will hide me. He will set me high upon a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then my head will be lifted up above all those around me who hate me. I will give gifts in His holy tent with a loud voice of joy. I will sing. Yes, I will sing praises to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, listen to my cry. Show loving-kindness to me and answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have said, “Look for My face.” My heart said to You, “O Lord, Your face will I look for.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not hide Your face from me. Do not turn Your servant away in anger. You have been my Helper. Do not turn away from me or leave me alone, O God Who saves me!
speaker: Narrator

text: For my father and my mother have left me. But the Lord will take care of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me Your way, O Lord. Lead me in a straight path, because of those who fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not give me over to the desire of those who hate me. For people who tell lies about me rise against me, and breathe a desire to hurt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would have been without hope if I had not believed that I would see the loving-kindness of the Lord in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait for the Lord. Be strong. Let your heart be strong. Yes, wait for the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, to You I call. O my Rock, listen to me. If You will not hear me, I will be like those who have gone down to the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my cry for loving-kindness as I call to You for help, and when I lift up my hands to Your holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not drag me away with the sinful and with those who do bad things. They speak peace with their neighbors, while sin is in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pay them for their work and for the sins they do. Pay them for the works of their hands. Give them what they have earned.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not think about the works of the Lord and what His hands have done. So He will pull them down and not build them up again.
speaker: Narrator

text: May honor and thanks be given to the Lord, because He has heard my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my strength and my safe cover. My heart trusts in Him, and I am helped. So my heart is full of joy. I will thank Him with my song.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is the strength of His people. He is a safe place for His chosen one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save Your people and bring good to what is Yours. Be their shepherd and carry them forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to the Lord, O sons of the powerful. Give to the Lord shining-greatness and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to the Lord the honor that belongs to Him. Worship the Lord in the beauty of holy living.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters. The God of shining-greatness thunders. The Lord is over many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord is powerful. The voice of the Lord is great.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars. Yes, the Lord breaks in pieces the tall cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes Lebanon jump like a calf, and Sirion like a young wild bull.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord sends out lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord shakes the desert. The Lord shakes the desert of Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord makes the deer give birth, and tears away the leaves of the trees. And in His holy house everything says, “Honor to God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord sat as King over the flood. The Lord sits as King forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will give strength to His people. The Lord will give His people peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lift You up, O Lord, for You have lifted me up. You have not let those who hate me stand over me in joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, I cried to You for help and You healed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, You have brought me up from the grave. You have kept me alive, so that I will not go down into the deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praise to the Lord, all you who belong to Him. Give thanks to His holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For His anger lasts only a short time. But His favor is for life. Crying may last for a night, but joy comes with the new day.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, when all was going well, I said, “I will never be moved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, by Your favor You have made my mountain stand strong. But when You hid Your face, I was troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried to You, O Lord. I begged the Lord for loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: What good will come from my blood, if I go down to the grave? Will the dust thank You? Will it tell how You are faithful?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Lord. And show me loving-kindness. O Lord, be my Helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have turned my crying into dancing.You have taken off my clothes made from hair, and dressed me with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So my soul may sing praise to You, and not be quiet. O Lord my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, in You I have found a safe place. Let me never be ashamed. Set me free, because You do what is right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn Your ear to me, and be quick to save me. Be my rock of strength, a strong place to keep me safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You are my rock and my safe place. For the honor of Your name, lead me and show me the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will free me from the net that they have hidden for me. For You are my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give my spirit into Your hands. You have made me free, O Lord, God of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate those who worship false gods. But I trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad and full of joy in Your loving-kindness. For You have seen my suffering. You have known the troubles of my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not given me into the hand of those who hate me. You have set my feet in a large place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me loving-kindness, O Lord, for I am in trouble. My eyes, my soul and my body are becoming weak from being sad.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my life gets weaker with sorrow, and my years with crying inside myself. My strength has left me because of my sin. And my bones waste away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of all those who hate me, I have become a shame to my neighbors. Even my friends do not want to be with me. Those who see me on the street run from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am forgotten like a dead man and they do not think about me. I am like a broken pot.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have heard many say things to hurt me. Fear is on every side. They planned together against me. They thought of ways to take away my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I trust in You, O Lord. I say, “You are my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: My times are in Your hands. Free me from the hands of those who hate me, and from those who try to hurt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make Your face shine upon Your servant. Save me in Your loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let me be put to shame, O Lord. For I call to You. Let the sinful be put to shame. Let them be quiet in the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the lying lips be quiet. For they speak with pride and hate those who do right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: How great is Your loving-kindness! You have stored it up for those who fear You. You show it to those who trust in You in front of the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will hide them with You in secret from the sinful plans of men. You keep them in Your tent in secret from those who fight with tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and thanks be to the Lord. For He has shown His great loving-favor to me when I was in a city with armies all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: In my fear I said, “You have closed Your eyes to me!” But You heard my cry for loving-kindness when I called to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Love the Lord, all you who belong to Him! The Lord keeps the faithful safe. But He gives the proud their pay in full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong. Be strong in heart, all you who hope in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: How happy he is whose wrong-doing is forgiven, and whose sin is covered!
speaker: Narrator

text: How happy is the man whose sin the Lord does not hold against him, and in whose spirit there is nothing false.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I kept quiet about my sin, my bones wasted away from crying all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: For day and night Your hand was heavy upon me. My strength was dried up as in the hot summer.
speaker: Narrator

text: I told my sin to You. I did not hide my wrong-doing. I said, “I will tell my sins to the Lord.” And You forgave the guilt of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: So let all who are God-like pray to You while You may be found, because in the floods of much water, they will not touch him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are my hiding place. You keep me safe from trouble. All around me are your songs of being made free.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will show you and teach you in the way you should go. I will tell you what to do with My eye upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be like the horse or the donkey which have no understanding. They must be made to work by using bits and leather ropes or they will not come to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many are the sorrows of the sinful. But loving-kindness will be all around the man who trusts in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be glad in the Lord and be full of joy, you who are right with God! Sing for joy all you who are pure in heart!
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing for joy in the Lord, you who are right with Him. It is right for the pure in heart to praise Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to the Lord with harps. Sing praises to Him with a harp of ten strings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to Him a new song. Play well with loud sounds of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Word of the Lord is right. He is faithful in all He does.
speaker: Narrator

text: He loves what is right and good and what is fair. The earth is full of the loving-kindness of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens were made by the Word of the Lord. All the stars were made by the breath of His mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gathers the waters of the sea together as in a bag. He places the waters in store-houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all the earth fear the Lord. Let all the people of the world honor Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He spoke, and it was done. He spoke with strong words, and it stood strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord brings the plans of nations to nothing. He wrecks the plans of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The plans of the Lord stand forever. The plans of His heart stand through the future of all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is the nation whose God is the Lord. Happy are the people He has chosen for His own.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord looks from heaven. He sees all the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: From where He sits He looks upon all who live on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the hearts of them all. And He understands whatever they do.
speaker: Narrator

text: No king is saved by the power of his strong army. A soldier is not saved by great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: A horse cannot be trusted to win a battle. Its great strength cannot save anyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, the eye of the Lord is on those who fear Him, and on those who hope for His loving-kindness,
speaker: Narrator

text: to save their soul from death, and to keep them alive when there is nothing to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our soul waits for the Lord. He is our help and our safe cover.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our heart is full of joy in Him, because we trust in His holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, let Your loving-kindness be upon us as we put our hope in You.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will honor the Lord at all times. His praise will always be in my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul will be proud to tell about the Lord. Let those who suffer hear it and be filled with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give great honor to the Lord with me. Let us praise His name together.
speaker: Narrator

text: I looked for the Lord, and He answered me. And He took away all my fears.
speaker: Narrator

text: They looked to Him and their faces shined with joy. Their faces will never be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him. And He saved him out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord stays close around those who fear Him, and He takes them out of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: O taste and see that the Lord is good. How happy is the man who trusts in Him!
speaker: Narrator

text: O fear the Lord, all you who belong to Him. For those who fear Him never want for anything.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lions suffer want and hunger. But they who look for the Lord will not be without any good thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, you children, listen to me. I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the man who has a desire for life, and wants to live long so that he may see good things?
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep your tongue from sin and your lips from speaking lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn away from what is sinful. Do what is good. Look for peace and follow it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of the Lord are on those who do what is right and good. His ears are open to their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: The face of the Lord is against those who sin. He will keep the people of the earth from remembering them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who are right with the Lord cry, and He hears them. And He takes them from all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is near to those who have a broken heart. And He saves those who are broken in spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man who does what is right and good may have many troubles. But the Lord takes him out of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: He keeps all his bones safe. Not one of them is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sin will kill the sinful. And those who hate God’s people will be held guilty and punished forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord saves the soul of those who work for Him. None of those who trust in Him will be held guilty.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, stand against those who stand against me. Fight those who fight me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take hold of a safe-covering and rise up to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take a spear and battle-ax against those who come to get me. Say to my soul, “I am the One Who saves you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the people be ashamed and without honor who want to take my life. Let those be turned away and brought to shame who plan to hurt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be like straw in the wind. May the angel of the Lord drive them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their way be dark and dangerous, with the angel of the Lord going to get them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For without a reason they hid their net for me. Without a reason, they dug a hole for my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be destroyed before they know it. And let them be caught in their own net. May they destroy themselves as they fall into their own hole.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul will be happy in the Lord. It will be full of joy because He saves.
speaker: Narrator

text: All my bones will say, “Lord, who is like You? Who saves the weak from those too strong for them? Who saves the poor from those who would rob them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: People come telling lies. They ask me of things that I do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: They pay me what is bad in return for what is good. My soul is sad.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they were sick, I put on clothes made from hair. With no pride in my soul, I would not eat. And I prayed with my head on my chest.
speaker: Narrator

text: I went about as if it were my friend or brother. I put my head down in sorrow, like one crying for his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when I would fall, they would gather together in joy. Those who say things to hurt people would gather against me. I did not know them. They spoke against me without stopping.
speaker: Narrator

text: They ground their teeth at me like bad people making fun of others at a special supper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, how long will You look on? Save me from being destroyed by them. Save my life from the lions.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give You thanks in the big meeting. I will praise You among many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let those who hate me for no reason stand over me with joy. Do not let those who hate me for no reason wink their eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not speak peace. But they make up lies against those who are quiet in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they opened their mouth wide against me. They said, “O, O, our eyes have seen it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You have seen it, O Lord. Do not keep quiet. O Lord, do not be far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake Yourself. Come and help me. Fight for me, my God and my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say what is right or wrong with me, O Lord my God, because You are right and good. Do not let them have joy over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let them say in their heart, “O, just what we wanted!” Do not let them say, “We have swallowed him up!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all who are happy because of my trouble be ashamed and without honor. Let those who think they are better than I, be covered with shame and without honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them call out for joy and be glad, who want to see the right thing done for me. Let them always say, “May the Lord be honored. He is pleased when all is going well for His servant.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And my tongue will tell about how right and good You are, and about Your praise all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sin speaks to the sinful man within his heart. There is no fear of God in his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he makes much of himself in his own eyes. So his sin is not known and hated.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of his mouth are sinful and false. He has stopped being wise and doing good.
speaker: Narrator

text: He plans wrong-doing upon his bed. He sets himself on a path that is not good. He does not hate what is bad.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, Your loving-kindness goes to the heavens. You are as faithful as the sky is high.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are as right and good as mountains are big. You are as fair when You judge as a sea is deep. O Lord, You keep safe both man and animal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of what great worth is Your loving-kindness, O God! The children of men come and are safe in the shadow of Your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are filled with the riches of Your house. And You give them a drink from Your river of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: All life came from You. In Your light we see light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep on giving Your loving-kindness to those who know You. Keep on being right and good to the pure in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let the foot of pride come near me. Do not let the hand of the sinful push me away.
speaker: Narrator

text: There have the wrong-doers fallen. They have been thrown down, and cannot rise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not trouble yourself because of sinful men. Do not want to be like those who do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they will soon dry up like the grass. Like the green plant they will soon die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in the Lord, and do good. So you will live in the land and will be fed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be happy in the Lord. And He will give you the desires of your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give your way over to the Lord. Trust in Him also. And He will do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will make your being right and good show as the light, and your wise actions as the noon day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rest in the Lord and be willing to wait for Him. Do not trouble yourself when all goes well with the one who carries out his sinful plans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stop being angry. Turn away from fighting. Do not trouble yourself. It leads only to wrong-doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who do wrong will be cut off. But those who wait for the Lord will be given the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: A little while, and the sinful man will be no more. You will look for his place, and he will not be there.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who have no pride will be given the earth. And they will be happy and have much more than they need.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful man plans against him who is right with God. And he grinds his teeth at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord laughs at him because He sees his day is coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful have taken up their sword and their bow, to bring down the poor and those in need, and to kill those whose ways are right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sword will cut into their own heart, and their bows will be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: The few things that the man right with God has is better than the riches of many sinful men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the arms of the sinful will be broken. But the Lord holds up those who are right with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord knows the days of those who are without blame. And what is theirs will last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will not be ashamed in the time of trouble. And in days when there is no food they will have enough.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the sinful will be lost forever. Those who hate the Lord will be like the beauty of the fields. They will be gone. Like smoke they will be gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful ask for something, but do not return it. But those who are right with God are kind and give.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who are made happy by Him will be given the land. But those who are being punished by Him will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The steps of a good man are led by the Lord. And He is happy in his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he falls, he will not be thrown down, because the Lord holds his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been young, and now I am old. Yet I have never seen the man who is right with God left alone, or his children begging for bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: All day long he is kind and lets others use what he has. And his children make him happy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn from sin, and do good, so you will live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord loves what is fair and right. He does not leave the people alone who belong to Him. They are kept forever. But the children of the sinful will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who are right with God will be given the land, and live on it forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of the man who is right with God speaks wisdom. And his tongue speaks what is fair and right.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Law of his God is in his heart. His steps do not leave it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful lie in wait for the man who is right with God, and want to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will not leave him in his power. He will not let him be found guilty when he is judged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wait for the Lord. Keep His way. And He will give you a high place to receive the land. When the sinful are cut off, you will see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen a very sinful man spreading himself like a green tree in its home land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he passed away and was no more. I looked for him. But he could not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look at the man without blame. And watch the man who is right and good. For the man of peace will have much family to follow him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the sinners will be destroyed. The family of the sinful will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the saving of those who are right with God is from the Lord. He is their strength in time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord helps them and takes them out of trouble. He takes them away from the sinful, and saves them, because they go to Him for a safe place.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, do not speak sharp words to me when You are angry. Do not punish me in Your burning anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Your arrows have cut deep into me. And Your hand has come down upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My body is in pain because of Your anger. There is no strength in my bones because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my sins are gone over my head. Like a heavy load, they weigh too much for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My sores smell and grow bigger because I do foolish things.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cannot stand straight but keep my head down. I have sorrow all day long
speaker: Narrator

text: for my body is filled with burning pain. There is no strength in my body.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am weak and broken. I cry because of the pain in my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, all my desire is before You. And my breathing deep within is not hidden from You.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart beats fast. My strength leaves me. Even the light of my eyes has gone from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My loved ones and my friends stay away from me because of my sickness. My family stands far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who want to take my life set their traps. And those who want to destroy me talk about ways to do it. They make their sinful plans all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: But like a deaf man, I do not hear. I am like one who cannot speak and does not open his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, I am like a man who does not hear, and whose mouth does not argue.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I hope in You, O Lord. You will answer, O Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said, “Do not let them be happy and raise themselves up against me when my foot trips.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am ready to fall. And my sorrow is always with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I tell my wrong-doings. I am full of sorrow because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who fight against me are full of action and strength. There are many who hate me without reason.
speaker: Narrator

text: They pay what is bad for what is good. They are against me because I follow what is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not leave me alone, O Lord! O my God, do not be far from me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Hurry to help me, O Lord, Who saves me!
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, “I will watch my ways so I may not sin with my tongue. I will keep my mouth shut as if it were tied with ropes, while the sinful are near me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I stayed quiet, not even saying anything good. And my sorrow grew worse.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart was hot within me. As I thought about things, the fire burned. Then I spoke with my tongue,
speaker: Narrator

text: “O Lord, let me know my end and how many days I have to live. Let me know that I do not have long to stay here.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made each of my days as long as a hand is wide. My whole life is nothing in Your eyes. Every man at his best is only a breath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man walks here and there like a shadow. He makes a noise about nothing. He stores up riches, not knowing who will gather them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me from all my sins. Do not let me be put to shame by the foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cannot speak. I do not open my mouth because it is You Who has done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not punish me any more. I am growing weak by the beatings of Your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: With sharp words You punish a man for sin. You destroy like a moth what is of worth to him. For sure, every man is only a breath.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, hear my prayer, and listen to my cry. Do not be quiet when You see my tears. For I am a stranger with You, a visitor like all my fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look away from me, so I may have joy again before I go and am no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I did not give up waiting for the Lord. And He turned to me and heard my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought me up out of the hole of danger, out of the mud and clay. He set my feet on a rock, making my feet sure.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put a new song in my mouth, a song of praise to our God. Many will see and fear and will put their trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: How happy is the man who has made the Lord his trust, and has not turned to the proud or to the followers of lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, many are the great works You have done, and Your thoughts toward us. No one can compare with You! If I were to speak and tell of them, there would be too many to number.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not wanted gifts given on the altar in worship. You have opened my ears. You have not wanted burnt gifts or gifts to cover sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, “Look, I have come. It is written about me in the book.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am happy to do Your will, O my God. Your Law is within my heart.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I have told the good news about what is right and good in the big meeting with many people. You know I will not close my lips, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not hidden what is right and good with You in my heart. I have spoken about how faithful You are and about Your saving power. I have not hidden Your loving-kindness and Your truth from the big meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, You will not keep Your loving-pity from me. Your loving-kindness and Your truth will always keep me safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Too many troubles gather around me. My sins have taken such a hold on me that I am not able to see. There are more of them than there are hairs on my head. And the strength of my heart has left me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be pleased to save me, O Lord. Hurry, O Lord, to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all who want to destroy my life be ashamed and troubled. Let those who want to hurt me be turned away without honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who say to me, “O! O!” be filled with fear because of their shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let all who look for You have joy and be glad in You. Let those who love Your saving power always say, “The Lord be honored!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Because I suffer and am in need, let the Lord think of me. You are my help and the One Who sets me free. O my God, do not wait.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is the man who cares for the poor. The Lord will save him in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will keep him alive and safe. And he will be happy upon the earth. You will not give him over to the desire of those who hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will give him strength on his bed of sickness. When he is sick, You will make him well again.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, I said, “O Lord, have loving-kindness for me. Heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who hate me speak bad words against me, saying, “When will he die, and his name be forgotten?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When one comes to see me, he speaks lies. His heart gathers up bad stories. Then he goes outside and tells them.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who hate me speak in secret together against me. They make plans to hurt me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “A bad thing has come over him. When he lies down, he will not rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Even a friend of mine whom I trusted, who ate my bread, has turned against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have loving-kindness for me, O Lord. Raise me up, so that I may pay them back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will know that You are pleased with me, because he who hates me does not win over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, You hold me up in my honesty. And You set me beside You forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor be to the Lord, the God of Israel, forever and ever! Let it be so!
speaker: Narrator

text: As the deer desires rivers of water, so my soul desires You, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is thirsty for God, for the living God. When will I come and meet with God?
speaker: Narrator

text: My tears have been my food day and night, while men say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I remember, and I pour out my soul within me. For I used to go with many people and lead them to the house of God, with the voice of thankful joy, among the many happy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why are you sad, O my soul? Why have you become troubled within me? Hope in God, for I will praise Him again for His help of being near me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, my soul is troubled within me. So I remember You from the land of the Jordan and the tops of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sea calls to sea at the sound of Your waterfalls. All Your waves have rolled over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will send His loving-kindness in the day. And His song will be with me in the night, a prayer to the God of my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say to God my Rock, “Why have You forgotten me? Why do I have sorrow because those who hate me come against me with power?”
speaker: Narrator

text: As a breaking of my bones, those who hate me speak sharp words to me. All day long they say to me, “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Why are you sad, O my soul? Why have you become troubled within me? Hope in God, for I will yet praise Him, my help and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand by me, O God, and speak in my favor against a sinful nation. Save me from the lying and sinful man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You are the God of my strength. Why have You turned away from me? Why do I have sorrow because those who hate me come against me with power?
speaker: Narrator

text: Send out Your light and Your truth. Let them lead me. Let them bring me to Your holy hill and to the places where You live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will go to the altar of God, the God of my joy. And I will praise You with the harp, O God, my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why are you sad, O my soul? Why have you become troubled within me? Hope in God, for I will praise Him again, my help and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, we have heard with our ears. Our fathers have told us what work You did in their days, in the days long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text: With Your own hand You made the nations leave, and put our fathers in the land. You brought trouble upon the nations, and You spread them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was not by their sword that they took the land. Their own arm did not save them. But it was Your right hand, and Your arm, and the light of Your face, for You favored them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are my King, O God. Jacob wins because You say it must be so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through You we will push away those who hate us. Through Your name we will walk over those who rise up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will not trust my bow, and my sword will not save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You have saved us from those who fight against us. You have put to shame those who hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God we have had our pride all day long. And we will give thanks to Your name forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now You have turned from us and have put us to shame. You do not go out with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: You made us turn away from those who fight against us. And those who hate us have robbed us.
speaker: Narrator

text: You give us up to be eaten like sheep. You have spread us out among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: You sell Your people for nothing, and become no richer from their price.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made us a shame to our neighbors. Those around us laugh and make fun of us.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made us hated among the nations. The people laugh at us.
speaker: Narrator

text: All day long my shame is with me and has become too much for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who talk against me, and who hate me are around me and want to punish me.
speaker: Narrator

text: All this has come upon us, but we have not forgotten You. We have not been false to Your agreement.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our heart has not turned away. And our steps have not turned from Your way.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You have crushed us in a place of wild dogs, and covered us with the shadow of death.
speaker: Narrator
