text: If we had forgotten the name of our God, or put out our hands to a strange god,
speaker: Narrator

text: would not God find this out? For He knows the secrets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we are killed all day long because of You. We are thought of as sheep that are ready to be killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, O Lord! Why do You sleep? Rise up! Do not turn away from us forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do You hide Your face? Why do You forget our troubles and our suffering?
speaker: Narrator

text: For our soul is brought down to the dust. Our body holds on to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up and help us! Save us because of Your loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart flows over with good words. I sing my songs to the King. My tongue writes the words of a good writer.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are more beautiful than the children of men. Loving-favor is poured upon Your lips. So God has honored You forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put Your sword on at Your side, O Powerful One, in Your greatness and power that can be seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in Your great power, move on to win the fight for truth and for not having pride and for what is right and good. Let Your right hand teach You to do great things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your arrows are sharp. The people fall under You. Your arrows are in the heart of those who hate the King.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, Your throne is forever and ever. You rule Your holy nation by what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have loved what is right and good. You have hated what is wrong. That is why God, Your God, has chosen You. He has poured over You the oil of joy more than over anyone else.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Your clothes smell of fine perfumes. Out of ivory palaces music of strings have made You glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Daughters of kings are among Your women of honor. At Your right hand stands the queen, wearing gold from Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen, O daughter, hear my words and think about them. Forget your people and your father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the King will desire your beauty. Because He is your Lord, bow down to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of Tyre will come with a gift. The rich people will ask for your favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The daughter of the King is beautiful within. Her clothes are made with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: She will be led to the King in clothes sewed for beauty. The young women who have never had men are her friends. They follow her and will be brought to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will be led in with joy and happiness, because they will come into the King’s palace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead of Your fathers, it will be Your sons whom You will make rulers over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make Your name to be remembered to all the children-to-come. So that the nations will honor You forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is our safe place and our strength. He is always our help when we are in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we will not be afraid, even if the earth is shaken and the mountains fall into the center of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and even if its waters go wild with storm and the mountains shake with its action.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a river whose waters make glad the city of God, the holy place where the Most High lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is in the center of her. She will not be moved. God will help her when the morning comes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people made noise. The nations fell. He raised His voice and the earth melted.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord of All is with us. The God of Jacob is our strong place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and see the works of the Lord. He has destroyed parts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stops wars to the ends of the earth. He breaks the bow and cuts the spear in two. He burns the war-wagons with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be quiet and know that I am God. I will be honored among the nations. I will be honored in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord of All is with us. The God of Jacob is our strong place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show your happiness, all peoples! Call out to God with the voice of joy!
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord Most High is to be feared. He is a great King over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sets people under us, and nations under our feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: He chooses for us what is to be ours, the pride of Jacob, whom He loves.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has gone up with a loud voice, the Lord with the sound of a horn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises to God. Sing praises. Sing praises to our King. Sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is the King of all the earth. Sing praises with a well written song.
speaker: Narrator

text: God rules over the nations. God sits on His holy throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rulers of the people have gathered together as the people of the God of Abraham. For the powers of the earth belong to God. He is much honored.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is great and should be given much praise, in the city of our God, His holy mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mount Zion in the far north is beautiful and high, the joy of the whole earth, the city of the great King.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has made Himself known as a safe place in that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, see, the kings gathered themselves and went up together.
speaker: Narrator

text: They saw it, then they were surprised and afraid. And they ran away fast in fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: They began shaking there. And they suffered pain like a woman giving birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You wreck the ships of Tarshish with the east wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we have heard, so we have seen in the city of the Lord of All, in the city of our God. God will make her last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, we have thought about Your loving-kindness within Your holy house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like Your name, O God, Your praise is heard to the ends of the earth. Your right hand is full of what is right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Mount Zion be glad! Let the people of Judah be full of joy because You are right in how You judge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Walk in Zion, and go around her. See how many towers she has.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thought to her walls. Go through her beautiful houses where kings live. And tell about it to the children-to-come.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is God, our God forever and ever. He will show us the way until death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear this, all people. Listen, all who live in the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: both small and great, rich and poor together.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth will speak wisdom. And the thoughts of my heart will be understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will turn my ear to a wise saying. With a harp, I will tell what is hard to understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should I be afraid in the days of trouble, when the sin of those who hate me is all around me?
speaker: Narrator

text: They trust in their riches, and are proud of all they have.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man can save his brother. No man can pay God enough to save him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cost is much for his soul to be saved. Man should stop trying
speaker: Narrator

text: to live forever and not see the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he sees that even wise men die. The fool and those who cannot think well die alike. And they leave their riches to others.
speaker: Narrator

text: They think in their hearts that their houses will last forever, and that the places where they live will last for all their children to follow. They have used their own names to name their lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But man with all his honor does not last. He is like the animals that die.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the way of the foolish, and of those after them who believe in their words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like sheep they are meant for the grave. Death will be their shepherd. And those who are right with God will rule over them in the morning. Their bodies will be eaten by the grave, so that they have no place to stay.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God will free my soul from the power of the grave. For He will take me to Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be afraid when a man becomes rich and when his house grows in greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when he dies he will take nothing with him. His greatness will not go down with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even if while he lives, he thinks good of himself, and even though men praise you when you do well for yourself,
speaker: Narrator

text: he will go and join the family of his fathers. They will never see the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man with all his honor, yet without understanding, is like the animals that die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Powerful One, God, the Lord, has spoken. And He calls the earth from where the sun rises to where the sun goes down.
speaker: Narrator

text: God shines from Zion, perfect in beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: May our God come and not keep quiet. A fire burns before Him, and around Him is a powerful storm.
speaker: Narrator

text: He calls the heavens above, and the earth, that He may judge His people:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Gather My holy ones to Me, those who have made an agreement with Me by their gifts given on an altar.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heavens will tell how right and good He is, for God Himself is judge.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Listen, O My people, and I will speak. O Israel, I will speak against you. I am God, your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not speak sharp words to you for your gifts given on an altar. And your burnt gifts are always before Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not take a young bull out of your house, or male goats out of your fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every animal among the trees is Mine, and the cattle on a thousand hills.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know every bird of the mountains. And all things that move in the field are Mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I were hungry, I would not tell you. For the world is Mine, and all that is in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Should I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of male goats?
speaker: Narrator

text: Give a gift of thanks on the altar to God. And pay your promises to the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: Call on Me in the day of trouble. I will take you out of trouble, and you will honor Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the sinful, God says: “What right do you have to tell of My Laws, and take My agreement in your mouth?
speaker: Narrator

text: For you hate to be told what to do, and you throw My words behind you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you see a robber, you are pleased with him. And you join those who do sex sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: You say bad things with your mouth, and you lie with your tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: You sit and speak against your brother. You talk against your own mother’s son.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have done these things, and I have kept quiet. You thought that I was just like you. But I will speak sharp words to you, and tell you who is guilty to your face.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now think about this, you who forget God, or I will tear you in pieces and there will be no one to save you.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who gives a gift of thanks honors Me. And to him who makes his way right, I will show him the saving power of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, favor me because of Your loving-kindness. Take away my wrong-doing because of the greatness of Your loving-pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wash me inside and out from my wrong-doing and make me clean from my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know my wrong-doing, and my sin is always in front of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sinned against You, and You only. I have done what is sinful in Your eyes. You are always right when You speak, and fair when You judge.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I was born in sin and was in sin from my very beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, You want truth deep within the heart. And You will make me know wisdom in the hidden part.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take away my sin, and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me hear joy and happiness. Let the bones that You have broken be full of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide Your face from my sins. And take away all my wrong-doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make a clean heart in me, O God. Give me a new spirit that will not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not throw me away from where You are. And do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the joy of Your saving power return to me. And give me a willing spirit to obey you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will teach wrong-doers Your ways. And sinners will turn to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me from the guilt of blood, O God. You are the God Who saves me. Then my tongue will sing with joy about how right and good You are.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, open my lips, so my mouth will praise You.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You are not happy with a gift given on the altar in worship, or I would give it. You are not pleased with burnt gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gifts on an altar that God wants are a broken spirit. O God, You will not hate a broken heart and a heart with no pride.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be pleased to do good to Zion. Build the walls of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then You will be happy with gifts given on the altar that are right and good, with burnt gifts and whole burnt gifts. Then young bulls will be given on Your altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do you take pride in wrong-doing, O powerful man? The loving-kindness of God lasts all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your tongue makes plans to destroy like a sharp knife, you who lie.
speaker: Narrator

text: You love what is bad more than what is good, and you speak lies more than you speak the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You love all words that destroy, O lying tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God will destroy you forever. He will pick you up and pull you away from your tent. He will pull up your roots from the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who are right will see and be afraid. They will laugh at him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Look, the man who would not make God his safe place, but trusted in his many riches and was strong in his sinful desire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God. I trust in the loving-kindness of God forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give You thanks forever because of what You have done. And I will hope in Your name, for it is good to be where those who belong to You are.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” They are sinful and have done bad things. There is no one who does good.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has looked down from heaven at the children of men to see if there is anyone who understands and looks for God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have all turned back. They have all turned to sin. There is no one who does good, not even one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have those who do wrong no understanding? They eat up My people like they eat bread. They have not called upon God.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they were, in much fear, where there was nothing to be afraid of. For God has spread out the bones of those who come against you. You put them to shame, because God has turned away from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O, that the saving of Israel would come out of Zion! Jacob will be full of joy and Israel will be glad when God returns His people to their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me by Your name, O God. And stand with me by Your power.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O God. Listen to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For strangers have risen against me. And men who hurt others want to take my life. They do not think about God.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, God is my Helper. The Lord is the One Who keeps my soul alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will punish those who hate me, for the wrong they have done. He will destroy them because He is faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad to give You a gift on the altar. I will give thanks to Your name, O Lord, for it is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He has taken me out of all trouble. And my eyes have looked without fear upon those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen to my prayer, O God. Do not hide Yourself from what I ask.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me and answer me. My thoughts trouble me and I have no peace,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of the voice of those who hate me and the power of the sinful. For they bring trouble upon me, and in anger they keep on having bad thoughts against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is in pain within me. The fears of death have come upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have begun shaking with fear. Fear has power over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I say, “If only I had wings like a dove, I would fly away and be at rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, I would go far away. I would live in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would hurry to my safe place, away from the wild wind and storm.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Mix them up, O Lord. Divide their tongues. For I have seen fighting and trouble in the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go around on its walls day and night. Sin and wrong-doing are within it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Destroying powers are in the city. Trouble and lies never leave its streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would be able to take it if one who hates me were putting me to shame. I could hide from him. It is not one who hates me who has put himself up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it is you, a man like myself, one who has gone with me, my close friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: We shared together. And we walked with the people in the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let death take them by surprise. Let them go down alive to the grave. For sin is with them where they live.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, I will call on God and the Lord will save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will cry out and complain in the evening and morning and noon, and He will hear my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will save my soul in peace from those who make war against me. For there are many who fight me.
speaker: Narrator

text: God sits on His throne forever. And He will hear them and bring trouble upon them, because there has been no change in them. They do not fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He goes against those who were at peace with him. He has broken his agreement.
speaker: Narrator

text: What he says is smoother than butter, but war is in his heart. His words are softer than oil, yet they are raised swords.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give all your cares to the Lord and He will give you strength. He will never let those who are right with Him be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You, O God, will bring the sinful down into the hole that destroys. Men who kill and lie will not live out half their days. But I will trust in You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me Your loving-kindness, O God, for man has walked on me. All day long the one who tries to keep me down fights with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: All day long those who hate me have walked on me. For there are many who fight against me with pride.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I am afraid, I will trust in You.
speaker: Narrator

text: I praise the Word of God. I have put my trust in God. I will not be afraid. What can only a man do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text: All day long they change my words to say what I did not say. They are always thinking of ways to hurt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go after me as in a fight. They hide themselves. They watch my steps, as they have waited to take my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they are bad, do not let them get away. Bring down the people in Your anger, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have seen how many places I have gone. Put my tears in Your bottle. Are they not in Your book?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then those who hate me will turn back when I call. I know that God is for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I praise the Word of God. I praise the Word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: In God I have put my trust. I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I am under an agreement with You, O God. I will give You gifts of thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You have set my soul free from death. You have kept my feet from falling, so I may walk with God in the light of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me loving-kindness, O God, show me loving-kindness. For my soul goes to You to be safe. And I will be safe in the shadow of Your wings until the trouble has passed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will cry to God Most High, to God Who finishes all things for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will send from heaven and save me. He will put to shame him who is breaking me under his feet. God will send His loving-kindness and His truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is among lions. I must lie among the sons of men who breathe fire, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and whose tongues are a sharp sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be lifted up above the heavens, O God. Let Your shining-greatness be above all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have set a net for my steps. My soul is brought down. They dug a deep hole in front of me. But they themselves have fallen into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart will not be moved, O God. My heart cannot be moved. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises!
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, my shining-greatness. Awake, harps. I will awake early in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I will give thanks to You among the people. I will sing praises to You among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Your loving-kindness is great to the heavens, and Your truth to the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be lifted up above the heavens, O God. Let Your shining-greatness be above all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you speak what is right and good, O you powerful ones? Are you always right in how you judge, O sons of men?
speaker: Narrator

text: No, in your heart you do what is wrong. You use your hands to hurt and destroy in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful go wrong as soon as they are born. Those who speak lies go the wrong way from birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their poison is like the poison of a snake. They are like a cobra that cannot or will not listen.
speaker: Narrator

text: It does not hear the voice of the man who has power over it, even if the man is very good in his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, break the teeth in their mouth. Break out the teeth of the young lions, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them flow away like water that pours. When he uses his arrows, let them have no heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be like a snail that melts away as it goes. Like a baby born dead, may they never see the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before your pots can feel the fire of thorns, He will blow them away with a storm, both the green and the burning ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who is right and good will be full of joy when he sees the sinful punished. He will wash his feet in their blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And men will say, “For sure there is pay for those who are right and good. For sure there is a God Who says who is guilty or not on the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, take me away from those who hate me. Put me up high above those who rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take me away from those who do wrong. And save me from those who kill.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, look, they lie in wait for my life. Strong men are gathering together to fight me, but not because of my wrong-doing or my sin, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have done no wrong, but they get ready to fight against me. Rise up to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You, O Lord God of All, God of Israel, rise up to punish all the nations. Show no loving-kindness to those people who cannot be trusted and plan sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: They return at evening. They sound like dogs and go around the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, they spit with their mouth. Swords are in their lips. And they say, “Who can hear us?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But You laugh at them, O Lord. You laugh at all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my Strength, I will watch for You. For God is my strong place.
speaker: Narrator

text: My God in His loving-kindness will meet me. God will let me look at those who come against me and know that I will win the fight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not kill them, or my people may forget. Divide them by Your power and bring them down, O Lord, our safe-covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be caught in their pride for the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips. For the lies and bad things they say,
speaker: Narrator

text: destroy them in anger. Destroy them so that they will be no more. Let it be known that God rules in Jacob and to the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They return at evening. They make sounds like dogs and go around the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go around looking for food and they show their teeth if they are not filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I will sing of Your strength. Yes, I will sing with joy of Your loving-kindness in the morning. For You have been a strong and safe place for me in times of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my Strength, I will sing praises to You. For God is my strong place and the God Who shows me loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, You have turned away from us. You have broken us. You have been angry. O heal us and turn to us again.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made the land shake. You have torn it open. Heal it where it is broken, for it shakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made Your people suffer hard things. You have given us wine to drink that makes us not able to walk straight.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have given a flag to those who fear You, so it may be seen because of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save us with Your right hand, and answer us, so Your loved ones may be set free.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has said in His holy place: “I will be full of joy. I will divide Shechem and the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gilead is Mine. And Manasseh is Mine. Ephraim is the covering for My head. Judah is My Law giver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab is where I wash My hands. I will throw My shoe over Edom. Call out, Philistia, because of me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have You not turned away from us, O God? And will You not go out with our armies, O God?
speaker: Narrator

text: O give us help against those who hate us. For the help of man is worth nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: With God’s help we will do well. And He will break under His feet those who fight against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my cry, O God. Listen to my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call to You from the end of the earth when my heart is weak. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You have been a safe place for me, a tower of strength where I am safe from those who fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me live in Your tent forever. Let me be safe under the covering of Your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You have heard my promises, O God. You have given me that which You give to those who fear Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will add days to the life of the king. His years will be as long as the lives of many children and grandchildren added together.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will stay forever with God. Set apart loving-kindness and truth to keep him safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I will sing thanks to Your name forever and keep my promises day by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is quiet and waits for God alone. He is the One Who saves me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He alone is my rock and the One Who saves me. He is my strong place. I will not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long will all of you go against a man to break him down, that you may kill him, like a wall that no longer stands straight, like a fence ready to fall?
speaker: Narrator

text: They have talked only about throwing him down from his high place. They find joy in lies. They pray with their mouth that good will come. But inside they hope that bad will come instead.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is quiet and waits for God alone. My hope comes from Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He alone is my rock and the One Who saves me. He is my strong place. I will not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: My being safe and my honor rest with God. My safe place is in God, the rock of my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in Him at all times, O people. Pour out your heart before Him. God is a safe place for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Men who are not important come to nothing. Men who are important are a lie. When weighed they go up. Together they weigh less than a breath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not get money in a wrong way or be proud in stolen things. If you get more riches, do not set your heart on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has spoken once. I have heard this twice: Power belongs to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And loving-kindness belongs to You, O Lord. For You pay every man by the work he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, You are my God. I will look for You with all my heart and strength. My soul is thirsty for You. My flesh is weak wanting You in a dry and tired land where there is no water.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I have seen You in the holy place. And I have seen Your power and Your shining-greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lips will praise You because Your loving-kindness is better than life.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I will give honor to You as long as I live. I will lift up my hands in Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul will be filled as with rich foods. And my mouth praises You with lips of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: On my bed I remember You. I think of You through the hours of the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You have been my help. And I sing for joy in the shadow of Your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul holds on to You. Your right hand holds me up.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who want to take my life and destroy it will go deep into the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will be given over to the power of the sword. They will become food for foxes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the king will be full of joy in God. All who are faithful to God will be full of joy. For the mouth of those who speak lies will be stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, hear my voice when I complain. Keep my life safe from the fear of those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hide me from the secret plans of the sinful and from the noise of those who do bad things.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have made their tongues sharp like a sword. They use poison words like arrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shoot at the man without blame from their hiding place. They are quick to shoot at him and are not afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: They talk each other into doing sinful things. They talk about setting hidden traps. They say, “Who will see them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They think of ways to do bad things, and say, “We have made a perfect plan!” For the inside thoughts and the heart of a man are deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God will shoot at them with an arrow. They will be hurt very soon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will be made to trip and fall. Their own tongue is against them. All who see them will shake their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all men will be afraid. They will tell about the work of God. And they will think about what He has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who is right and good will be glad in the Lord and go to Him to be safe. All those whose hearts are right will give Him praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: All will be quiet before You, and praise belongs to You, O God, in Zion. And our promise to You will be kept.
speaker: Narrator

text: O You Who hears prayer, to You all men come.
speaker: Narrator

text: My sins are strong against me. But You forgive our sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is the man You choose and bring near to You to live in Your holy place. We will be filled with the good things of Your house, Your holy house.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God Who saves us, You answer us in the way that is right and good by Your great works that make people stand in fear. You are the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest seas.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have built the mountains by Your strength. You are dressed with power.
speaker: Narrator

text: You quiet the storm of the seas, the sound of their waves, and the noise of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who live far away are afraid of Your great works. You make morning and evening call out for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: You visit the earth and water it. You make it very rich. The river of God is full of water. You give the people grain when You have made the earth ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: You water where the plow has been used. You cover the seeds with earth. You make it soft with rain. And You make the plants grow well.
speaker: Narrator

text: You crown the year with Your good gifts. There is more than enough where You have been.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fields of the desert are filled with water. And the hills dress themselves with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grass lands are covered with birds. And the valleys are covered with grain. They call out for joy and sing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Raise the voice of joy to God, all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing out the honor of His name! Make His praise great!
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to God, “How Your great works make those who hate You afraid! They will have to obey You because of Your great power.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the earth will worship You and sing praises to You. They will sing praises to Your name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and see what God has done. There is much fear because of His great works toward the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: He changed the sea into dry land. They passed through the river on foot. There we were full of joy in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He rules forever by His power. His eyes keep watch over the nations. Do not let those who do not obey You honor themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give honor and thanks to God, O people, and let all hear how great He is!
speaker: Narrator

text: He keeps us alive, and does not let our feet go out from under us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You have tested us, O God. You have made us pure like silver is made pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: You brought us into the net. And You laid a heavy load on our back.
speaker: Narrator

text: You made men travel over our heads. We went through fire and through water. But You brought us out into a place where we have much more than we need.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will come into Your house with burnt gifts. I will give You what I promised,
speaker: Narrator

text: promises made by my lips and spoken by my mouth when I was in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give You burnt gifts of fat animals with the smoke of rams. I will give You bulls with male goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come and hear, all who fear God, and I will tell you what He has done for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried to Him with my mouth and praised Him with my tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will not hear me if I hold on to sin in my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it is sure that God has heard. He has listened to the voice of my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and thanks be to God! He has not turned away from my prayer or held His loving-kindness from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: May God show loving-kindness toward us and bring good to us. May He make His face shine upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: May Your way be known on the earth, and Your saving power among all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the people praise You, O God. May all the people praise You.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the nations be glad and sing for joy. For You will be fair when You judge the people and rule the nations of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the people praise You, O God. May all the people praise You.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth has given its fruit. God, our God, will bring good to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: God will bring good to us, and all the ends of the earth will fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: May God rise up. May those who hate Him be divided. And may they run away from Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Drive them away like smoke in the wind. Let the sinful be destroyed before God like a candle melts by the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let those who are right and good be glad. Let them be happy before God. Yes, let them be full of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to God. Sing praises to His name. Make a road for Him Who goes through the deserts. The Lord is His name. Be full of joy before Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: God in His holy house is a father to those who have no father. And He keeps the women safe whose husbands have died.
speaker: Narrator

text: God makes a home for those who are alone. He leads men out of prison into happiness and well-being. But those who fight against Him live in an empty desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, when You went out before Your people, when You walked through the desert,
speaker: Narrator

text: the earth shook. The heavens poured down rain before God. And Sinai shook before God, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: You sent a heavy rain, O God. You brought life back to Your promised land when it was dry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your people made it their home. O God, You gave the poor what they needed because You are good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gives the Word. And the women who tell the good news are many.
speaker: Narrator

text: The kings of armies run. They run away. And she who stays at home divides the riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you lie down among the sheep, you are like the wings of a dove covered with silver, and the end of its wings with shining gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the All-powerful divided the kings there, snow was falling in Zalmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan. A mountain of many high tops is the mountain of Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: O mountains of many high tops, why do you look with jealousy at the mountain which God has chosen for His home? For sure, the Lord will live there forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The war-wagons of God are 20,000, even thousands of thousands. The Lord is among them, as at Sinai, in the holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have gone up on high. You have taken those who were held with You. You have received gifts of men, even among those who fought against You. So the Lord God may live there with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and thanks be to the Lord, Who carries our heavy loads day by day. He is the God Who saves us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our God is a God Who sets us free. The way out of death belongs to God the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God will break the head of those who hate Him, the hair-covered head of him who goes on in his sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan. I will bring them back from the bottom of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: So your feet may crush them in blood. And the tongue of your dogs may have a share of those who hate you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They have seen Your people walking together, O God. They have seen the people of my God and King walking into the holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who sing are in front. Those who play music are behind. And young women who beat timbrels are between.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to God in the meetings of worship. Give thanks to the Lord, you who are of the family of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is young Benjamin leading them. The rulers of Judah are among the people, and the rulers of Zebulun, and the rulers of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your God has called for your strength. Show Your strength, O God, Who has acted for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kings will bring gifts to You because of Your holy house at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak sharp words to the wild animals in the tall grass by the river, the group of bulls with the calves of the people. Walk on those who desire pieces of silver. Divide the people who have joy in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Princes will come from Egypt. Ethiopia will hurry to put her hands out to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to God, O nations of the earth. Sing praises to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to Him Who sits upon the heavens, the heavens of old. Listen, He sends out His voice, His powerful voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell of the power of God. His great power is over Israel and His strength is in the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, You are honored with fear as You come from Your holy place. The God of Israel Himself gives strength and power to His people. Honor and thanks be to God!
speaker: Narrator

text: Save me, O God, for the waters have almost taken my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have gone down into deep mud and there is no place to put my feet. I have come into deep waters and a flood comes over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have cried until I am tired. My mouth is dry. My eyes become weak while I wait for my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who hate me, without a reason, are more than the hairs on my head. Those who want to destroy me are powerful. I am made to return things that I did not steal.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, You know how foolish I am. My sins are not hidden from You.
speaker: Narrator

text: May those who wait for You not be put to shame because of me, O Lord God of All. May those who look for You not lose respect because of me, O God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been put to shame because of You. Shame has covered my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have become a stranger to my brothers, a stranger to my mother’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the strong desire for Your house has burned me up. And the bad things said about You have fallen on me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I cried and went without food, I was put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I put on clothes made from hair, they made fun of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who sit by the gate talk about me. And I am the song of those who drink too much.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, my prayer is to You at the right time, O Lord. Answer me with Your saving truth in Your great loving-kindness, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take me out of the mud and do not let me go down in it. Take me away from those who hate me and from the deep waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep the flood water from covering me. Do not let the sea swallow me up. Do not let the deep hole close its mouth over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Answer me, O Lord, for Your loving-kindness is good. Turn to me because of Your great loving-pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not hide Your face from Your servant, for I am in trouble. Hurry to answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come near to me and save me. Pay the price to set me free from those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know how I have been put to shame by the bad things said about me. All those who hate me are before You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Being put to shame has broken my heart, and I feel very sick. I looked for pity but there was none. I looked for someone to comfort me but there was no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave me bitter drink in my food. And because I was thirsty they gave me sour wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: May their table in front of them become a net. May it become a trap when they are in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: May their eyes grow dark so they cannot see. And may their backs always shake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour out Your anger on them. May Your burning anger catch up with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: May their place of living be empty and may no one live in their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have made it hard for the one You have punished. And they talk about the pain of those You have hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their sins add up, and may they not become right with You.
speaker: Narrator

text: May they be taken out of the book of life, and not be written down with those who are right with You.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am suffering and in pain. O God, may You save me and set me up on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the name of God with song. And I will give Him great honor with much thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will please the Lord more than any ox or young bull with horns and hoofs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those without pride will see it and be glad. You who look for God, let your heart receive new strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hears those who are in need, and does not hate His people in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let heaven and earth and the seas and all the things that move in them give thanks to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah. Then His people may live there and have it for their own.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of those who obey Him will have it given to them. Those who love His name will live there.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, hurry to take me out of trouble. O Lord, hurry to help me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who want to kill me be ashamed and brought low. Let those who want to hurt me be turned away in shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who say, “O, O!” be turned back because of their shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all who look for You be full of joy and be glad in You. And let those who love Your saving power always say, “Let God be honored.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am poor and in need. Hurry to me, O God! You are my help and the One Who takes me out of trouble. O Lord, do not wait.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have a safe place in you, O Lord. Let me never be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because You are right and good, take me out of trouble. Turn Your ear to me and save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be a rock to me where I live, where I may always come and where I will be safe. For You are my rock and my safe place.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, take me from the hand of the sinful, from the hand of the wrong-doer and the man without pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You are my hope, O Lord God. You are my trust since I was young.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have kept me safe from birth. It was You Who watched over me from the day I was born. My praise is always of You.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have become a wonder and surprise to many. For You are my strong safe place.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth is filled with Your praise and with Your honor all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let me fall by the way when I am old. Do not leave me alone when my strength is gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who hate me talk against me. Those who want to kill make plans together.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say, “God has turned away from him. Run and catch him, for there is no one to take him out of trouble.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, do not be far from me! O my God, hurry to help me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who are against me be ashamed and destroyed. Let those who want to hurt me be without honor and covered with shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I will always have hope and I will praise You more and more.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth will tell about how right and good You are and about Your saving acts all day long. For there are more than I can know.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will come in the strength of the Lord God. I will tell about how right and good You are, and You alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, You have taught me from when I was young. And I still tell about Your great works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even when I am old and my hair is turning white, O God, do not leave me alone. Let me tell about Your strength to all the people living now, and about Your power to all who are to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, You are right and good, as the heavens are high. You have done great things, O God. Who is like You?
speaker: Narrator

text: You have shown me many troubles of all kinds. But You will make me strong again. And You will bring me up again from deep in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Add to my greatness, and turn to comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, I will praise You with a harp. I will praise Your truth. I will sing praises to You with different kinds of harps, O Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: My lips will call out for joy when I sing praises to You. You have set my soul free.
speaker: Narrator

text: My tongue will tell about how right and good You are all day long. For those who want to hurt me are ashamed and troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, make the king right in what he decides. Make the king’s son right with You.
speaker: Narrator

text: May he be right when he decides who is right and who is wrong and may he be fair to the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let mountains and hills bring peace to the people through what is right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: May he stand by those who are poor, save the children of those in need, and destroy the bad power over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: May all the children-to-come fear You as long as the sun and the moon last.
speaker: Narrator

text: May He come down like rain upon the cut grass, like rain that waters the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In His days may all go well with those who are right and good. And may there be much peace until the moon is no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: May he also rule from sea to sea, and from the river to the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who live in the desert will put their faces to the ground before Him. And those who hate Him will kiss the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the kings of Tarshish and of the islands bring gifts. Let the kings of Sheba and Seba bring gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, let all kings fall down at His feet, and all nations serve Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He will take out of trouble the one in need when he cries for help, and the poor man who has no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will have loving-pity on the weak and those in need. He will save the lives of those in need.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will take them from the bad power that is held over them and from being hurt. Their blood will be of much worth in His eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will live, and the gold of Sheba will be given to Him. Prayer will be given for Him all the time. Let them honor Him all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: May there be much grain in the land on top of the mountains. May its fruit grow like the trees of Lebanon. And may those of the city grow like the grass of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: May His name last forever. May His name become bigger as long as the sun shines. And let men respect themselves through Him. Let all nations honor Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and thanks be to the Lord God, the God of Israel, Who alone does great things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And honor be to His great name forever. May the whole earth be filled with His shining-greatness. Let it be so.
speaker: Narrator

text: The prayers of David, the son of Jesse, are ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, my feet came close to falling. My steps had almost tripped.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was jealous of the proud when I saw that all was going well with the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they suffer no pain in their death, and their body is fat.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not have the troubles of other men or suffer like other men.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they wear pride around their neck. Fighting covers them like a coat.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are so fat that their eyes are pushed out. The crazy thoughts of their hearts run wild.
speaker: Narrator

text: They laugh at the truth, and speak sinful things about making it hard for others. They speak from a high place.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say bad things against heaven, and their tongue walks through the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so his people return to this place and drink water from a full cup.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say, “How does God know? Is there much learning with the Most High?”
speaker: Narrator

text: See, this is what the sinful are like. They always have it easy and their riches grow.
speaker: Narrator

text: For no good reason I have kept my heart pure and have not sinned.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have suffered all day long. I have been punished every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would not have been true to Your children if I had spoken this way.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was too hard for me when I tried to understand this,
speaker: Narrator

text: until I went into the holy place of God. Then I understood their end.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure, You set the sinful in places where there is danger at every step. You throw them down to be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: How they are destroyed right away! They come to an end with much fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like a dream when one wakes up, so You will hate what they look like when You rise up, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart was troubled and I was hurt inside.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was without reason and did not know better. I was like an animal before You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I am always with You. You hold me by my right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will lead me by telling me what I should do. And after this, You will bring me into shining-greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom have I in heaven but You? I want nothing more on earth, but You.
speaker: Narrator

text: My body and my heart may grow weak, but God is the strength of my heart and all I need forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, see, those who are far from You will be lost from You forever. You have destroyed all those who are not faithful to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, it is good to be near God. I have made the Lord God my safe place. So I may tell of all the things You have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, why have You turned away from us forever? Why does Your anger burn against the sheep in Your fields?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Your people that You bought a long time ago. You made them free to be the family of Your promise, and Mount Zion, where You have lived.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn Your steps toward this place that has been destroyed forever. Those who hate You have destroyed all that is in the holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who hate You have called out in the center of Your meeting place. They have set up their flags to show that they have won.
speaker: Narrator

text: They acted like men taking up axes against a group of trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of its fine work has been broken with axes and sticks.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have burned Your holy place to the dust. They have made dirty the house of Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said in their hearts, “Let us destroy all of these places!” They have burned all the meeting places where God was worshiped in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: We do not see any special things happening. There is no longer anyone who speaks for God. And none of us knows how long this will be.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, how long will those who hate You laugh at the truth? Will they speak against Your name forever?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do You take Your hand away, even Your right hand? Put it out and destroy them!
speaker: Narrator

text: God is still my King from long ago. He does saving works upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You divided the sea by Your power. You broke the heads of the large dragons in the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: You crushed the heads of the Leviathan. And You fed him to the animals of the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was You Who opened up the earth for water to flow out. And You dried up rivers that flow forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The day is Yours. And the night is Yours. You have set the light and the sun in their places.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have divided all the lands and seas and nations of the earth. You have made summer and winter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember how those who hate You have laughed at the truth, O Lord. Foolish people have spoken against Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not give the life of Your dove over to the wild animal. Do not forget the lives of Your troubled people forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Think about Your agreement. For the dark places of the land are full of fighting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let those who suffer under a bad power return without honor. Let those who suffer and those who are in need praise Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, O God. Stand up for Your rights. Remember how the foolish man speaks against You all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not forget the voice of those who hate You, the noise that comes without stopping from those who rise against You.
speaker: Narrator

text: We give thanks to You, O God. We give thanks that Your name is near. Men tell about the great things You have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: You say, “When the right time has come, I will be right and fair in deciding who is guilty or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the earth and all its people shake, it is I Who will hold it together.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said to the proud, ‘Do not speak with pride.’ And I said to the sinful, ‘Do not lift up the horn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not lift your horn up high. Do not speak in your pride.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: For honor does not come from the east or the west or from the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God is the One Who decides. He puts down one and brings respect to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is a cup in the Lord’s hand. It is full of strong wine that is well mixed. He pours out from it, and all the sinful people of the earth must drink all of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for me, I will tell of it forever. I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will cut off all the horns of the sinful. But the horns of those who are right with God will be lifted up.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is known in Judah. His name is great in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: His holy tent of worship is in Salem. He lives in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: There He broke the burning arrows, the iron covering and the sword, and all the things used for fighting in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are shining with greatness, more beautiful than the mountains with many animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: Strong men have been robbed. They sleep their last sleep. Not one of the soldiers can lift his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God of Jacob, both soldier and horse were put in a dead sleep because of Your sharp words.
speaker: Narrator

text: You alone are to be feared. Who may stand before You when You are angry?
speaker: Narrator

text: You said from heaven who is guilty or not. The earth was afraid and quiet
speaker: Narrator

text: when God stood up to say who is guilty or not, and to save all the people of the earth who are not proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the anger of man will praise You. And You will keep what is left of anger around You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make promises to the Lord your God and keep them. Let all who are around Him bring gifts to Him, Who is to be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will cut off the spirit of princes. He is feared by the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My voice goes up to God, and I will cry out. My voice goes up to God and He will hear me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I looked to the Lord when I was in trouble. I put out my hand at night, and it did not get tired. My soul would not be comforted.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I remember God, then I am troubled. When I am in deep thought, then my spirit becomes weak.
speaker: Narrator

text: You keep my eyes from closing. I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have thought about the days of old, the years of long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remember my song in the night. I think with my heart. And my spirit asks questions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will the Lord turn away forever? Will He never show favor again?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has His loving-kindness stopped forever? Has His promise come to an end for all time?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has God forgotten to be loving and kind? Has He in anger taken away His loving-pity?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, “It is my sorrow that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I will remember the things the Lord has done. Yes, I will remember the powerful works of long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will think of all Your work, and keep in mind all the great things You have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, Your way is holy. What god is great like our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: You are the God Who does great works. You have shown Your power among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have set free Your people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph, with Your strong arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters saw You, O God. The waters saw You and shook. The sea shook also.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clouds poured down water. The sky sounded with thunder. Your arrows of lightning went this way and that.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sound of Your thunder was in the turning wind. The lightning lit up the world. The earth shook.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your way was through the sea. Your paths went through the powerful waters. And it cannot be known where You stepped.
speaker: Narrator

text: You led Your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my people, hear my teaching. Listen to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will open my mouth in picture-stories. I will tell things which have been kept secret from long ago,
speaker: Narrator

text: which we have heard and known because our fathers have told us.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not hide them from their children. But we will tell the children-to-come the praises of the Lord, and of His power and the great things He has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He has made His will known to Jacob. He made the Law in Israel, which He told our fathers to teach their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children-to-come might know, even the children yet to be born. So they may rise up and tell it to their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they would put their trust in God and not forget the works of God. And they would keep His Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: They would not be like their fathers, who were not right with God and would not obey Him or be faithful to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ephraim were ready with their bows. But they turned away in the day of fighting.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not keep the agreement of God. And they would not walk in His Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: They forgot what He had done and His great works that He had shown them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did powerful works in front of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He divided the sea and made them pass through it. He made the water stand up like a wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: He led them with the cloud during the day, and with a light of fire during the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: He broke the rocks in the desert, and gave them water as if it flowed from the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made water come out of the rock. He made the water flow down like rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they still kept on sinning against Him. They did not obey the Most High in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: They tested God in their hearts by asking for the food they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they spoke against God, saying, “Can God set a table in the desert?
speaker: Narrator

text: See, He hit the rock and water poured out and rivers flowed over. Can He give bread also? Will He give meat to His people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord was full of anger when He heard them. And a fire was set against Jacob. His anger went up against Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they did not believe in God. They did not trust in Him to save them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet He spoke to the clouds above, and opened the doors of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent down bread from heaven for them to eat. He gave them food from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Men ate the bread of angels. He sent them all the food they could eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the east wind blow in the heavens. And He brought in the south wind by His power.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent meat down on them like dust, winged birds like the sand of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: He let them fall in the place where they were staying, all around their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they ate until they were full. He gave them what they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: But before they had eaten all they wanted, even while it was still in their mouths,
speaker: Narrator

text: the anger of God came upon them. And He killed the strongest of them. He cut down the young men of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But still they kept on sinning. They did not believe in His powerful works.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He made their days come to nothing. He made their years end in fear all at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He killed some of them, the others would look for Him. They returned and looked for God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They remembered that God was their rock, and that the Most High God was the One Who set them free.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they gave Him false honor with their mouth. They lied to Him with their tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their heart was not right toward Him. They were not faithful to His agreement.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He showed them loving-kindness and forgave their sins. He did not destroy them. He held back His anger many times. He did not let all of His anger loose.
speaker: Narrator

text: He remembered that they were only flesh, a wind that passes and does not return.
speaker: Narrator

text: How many times they went against Him in the desert, and gave Him sorrow in that empty land!
speaker: Narrator

text: They put God to the test again and again, and troubled the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not remember His power and the day He saved them from those who hated them,
speaker: Narrator

text: when He did His powerful works in Egypt and showed His greatness in the field of Zoan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He changed their rivers into blood. They could not drink from their rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent many flies among them that ate them, and frogs that destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave their fields of food to the grasshopper, and all they worked for to the locust.
speaker: Narrator

text: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with cold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed their cattle with hail and lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent them His burning anger and trouble. He sent a group of angels to bring trouble and sorrow to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a straight path for His anger. He did not save their soul from death. But He gave their lives over to all these troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed all the first-born in Egypt, the first children of their strength in the tents of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He brought His people out like sheep. And He led them like a flock in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: He led them and kept them safe, so they were not afraid. But the sea covered those who hated them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought them to His holy land, to the hill country His right hand had taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: He drove out the nations before them. He gave them parts of the land for a gift. And He made the families of Israel live in their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they tempted and went against the Most High God. They did not keep His Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: They turned away and acted without faith like their fathers. They were like a bow that cannot be trusted.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made Him angry with their sinful places of worship. And they made Him jealous with their false gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: God was very angry when He heard them, and He hated Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left the holy tent at Shiloh, the tent He had set up among men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He let His strength be taken. He put His greatness into the hands of those who hated Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He allowed His people to be killed with the sword. And He was very angry with those who belong to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fire burned up their young men. And their young women had no wedding songs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their religious leaders fell by the sword. And the women who lost their husbands could not cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord woke up as if from sleep, like a strong man wild with wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: He beat back those who hated Him. And He put them to shame forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned away from the tent of Joseph. He did not choose the family of Ephraim,
speaker: Narrator

text: but chose the family of Judah, Mount Zion which He loved.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built His holy place like the high mountains, like the earth He has built forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He chose David, His servant and took him from the flocks of sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought him from caring for the sheep and their lambs to being the shepherd of Jacob His people, and Israel who belongs to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David was their shepherd with a heart that was right, and led them with good hands and wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, the nations have come into the land of Your people. They have made Your holy house dirty. They have crushed the walls and buildings of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have given the dead bodies of Your servants to the birds of the heavens for food. The flesh of those who belong to You has been given to the wild animals of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem. And there was no one to bury them.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have become a shame to our neighbors. Those around us laugh at and make fun of us.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long, O Lord? Will You be angry forever? Will Your jealousy burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour out Your anger on the nations that do not know You, and on the nations that do not call on Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have destroyed Jacob. They have laid waste the place where he lived.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not hold the sins of our fathers against us. Let Your loving-pity come fast to meet us. For we are in much need.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God Who saves us, help us for the honor of Your name. Take us out of trouble and forgive our sins, for the honor of Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Make it known among the nations, in front of our eyes, that You punish for the blood that has poured from Your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the cries of those in prison. By the greatness of Your power, save those who are being sent to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And return to our neighbors seven times the shame that they have brought You, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we Your people, the sheep of Your field, will give thanks to You forever. We will tell of Your praise to all the people of all times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear us, O Shepherd of Israel, You Who lead Joseph like a flock! You Who sit on Your throne above the angels, let Your light shine!
speaker: Narrator

text: Stir up Your power in front of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manassah, and come to save us!
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, bring us back to You. Make Your face shine upon us, that we may be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of all, how long will You be angry with the prayers of Your people?
speaker: Narrator

text: You have fed them with the bread of tears. And You have made them drink a big amount of tears.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made us an object of arguing to our neighbors. Those who hate us laugh among themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God of all, bring us back to You. Make Your face shine upon us, and we will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: You brought a vine out of Egypt. You drove out the nations, and You planted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You cleared the land for it. And its roots went deep and filled the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains were covered with its shadow. And the tall trees were covered with its branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: It sent out its branches to the sea, and its new branches to the River.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why have You broken down its walls so that all who pass by pick its fruit?
speaker: Narrator

text: The wild pig from among the trees eats it away. And whatever moves in the field eats from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God of all, we beg You to return. Look down from heaven and see. Take care of this vine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take care of the root Your right hand has planted, and the branch that You have raised up for Yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have burned it with fire. It is cut down. May they be lost when they hear Your strong words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand, the son of man you have made strong for Yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we will not turn away from You. Give us new life again, and we will call on Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of all, bring us back to You. Make Your face shine upon us, and we will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing for joy to God our strength! Call out for joy to the God of Jacob!
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing a song, beat the timbrel. Play the sweet-sounding harps.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blow the horn at the new moon, at the full moon on the day of our special supper.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is a Law for Israel, a Law of the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made it a Law for Joseph, when he went through the land of Egypt. I heard a language that I did not know:
speaker: Narrator

text: “I took the load off his shoulders. His hands were set free from the basket.
speaker: Narrator

text: You called in your trouble, and I took you out of it. I answered you in the hiding place of thunder. I tested you at the waters of Meribah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O My people, and I will tell you what to do. O Israel, if you would listen to Me!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let there be no strange god among you. Do not worship any false god.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, the Lord, am your God. I brought you out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide and I will fill it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But My people did not listen to My voice. And Israel did not obey Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I let them follow the desires of their sinful hearts. They followed their own plans.
speaker: Narrator

text: If only My people would listen to Me! If only Israel would follow My ways!
speaker: Narrator

text: I would hurry to crush those who fight against them. I would turn My hand against those who hate them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who hate the Lord would pretend to obey Him. And their punishment would last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I would feed you with the best of grain. And I would fill you with honey from the rock.”
speaker: Narrator

text: God takes His stand in the great meeting of His people. He judges among the rulers.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long will you rulers be wrong in how you judge? How long will you show favor to the sinful?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do the right thing for the weak and those without a father. Stand up for the rights of those who are suffering and in need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save the weak and those in need. Set them free from the hand of the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: They know nothing; they understand nothing. They walk around in the dark. All that the earth is built upon is shaking.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, “You are gods. You are all sons of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you will die like men, and fall like one of the princes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, O God! Say who is guilty or not guilty upon the earth! For all the nations belong to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, do not keep quiet. Do not be quiet, O God, and do not hold Your peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, look, those who hate You are making much noise. Those who fight against You have honored themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: They make bad plans against Your people. They plan against those You care for.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say, “Come, let us destroy them as a nation. Let the name of Israel be remembered no longer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For they plan together with one mind. They make an agreement against You:
speaker: Narrator

text: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab and the Hagarites;
speaker: Narrator

text: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with those who live in Tyre;
speaker: Narrator

text: Assyria has joined them also. They help the children of Lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do to them as You did to Midian, and to Sisera and Jabin at the river of Kishon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were destroyed at Endor. They were spread over the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make their respected men like Oreb and Zeeb. Make their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
speaker: Narrator

text: who said, “Let us take for ourselves the fields of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O my God, make them like dust turning in the wind, like parts of the grass that have no worth and are blown away.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the fire that burns up the trees and spreads over the mountains,
speaker: Narrator

text: so go behind them with Your storm. Make them afraid with Your storm.
