speaker: Narrator

text: Fill their faces with shame, so they will look to Your name, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be ashamed and afraid forever. Let them be put to shame and lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they may know that You alone, Whose name is the Lord, are the Most High over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: How beautiful are the places where You live, O Lord of all!
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul wants and even becomes weak from wanting to be in the house of the Lord. My heart and my flesh sing for joy to the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the bird has found a home. The swallow has found a nest for herself where she may lay her young at Your altars, O Lord of all, my King and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: How happy are those who live in Your house! They are always giving thanks to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: How happy is the man whose strength is in You and in whose heart are the roads to Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text: As they pass through the dry valley of Baca, they make it a place of good water. The early rain fills the pools with good also.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go from strength to strength. Every one of them stands before God in Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God of all, hear my prayer. Listen, O God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon our safe-covering, O God. And look upon the face of Your chosen one.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a day in Your house is better than a thousand outside. I would rather be the one who opens the door of the house of my God, than to live in the tents of the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord God is a sun and a safe-covering. The Lord gives favor and honor. He holds back nothing good from those who walk in the way that is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord of all, how happy is the man who trusts in You!
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, You showed favor to Your land. You have returned those of Jacob who were taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have forgiven the sins of Your people. You have covered all their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have taken away all Your anger. You have turned away from Your burning anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God Who saves us, give us life again. Make Your anger toward us stop.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You spread out Your anger to families of all times?
speaker: Narrator

text: Will You not bring us back to life again so that Your people may be happy in You?
speaker: Narrator

text: Show us Your loving-kindness, O Lord, and save us.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will listen to what God the Lord will say. For He will speak peace to His people, to those who are right with Him. But do not let them turn again to foolish things.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure His saving power is near those who fear Him, so His shining-greatness may live in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Loving-kindness and truth have met together. Peace and what is right and good have kissed each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truth comes up from the earth. And what is right and good looks down from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, the Lord will give what is good. And our land will give its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: What is right and good will go before Him and make a way for His steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Lord, and answer me. For I am suffering and in need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep my life, for I am faithful to You. You are my God. Save Your servant who trusts in You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show me loving-kindness, O Lord. For I cry to You all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring joy to Your servant. For I lift up my soul to You, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You are good and ready to forgive, O Lord. You are rich in loving-kindness to all who call to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O Lord. Listen to my cry for help.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will call to You in the day of my trouble. For You will answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no one like You among the gods, O Lord. And there are no works like Yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the nations You have made will come and worship before You, O Lord. And they will bring honor to Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You are great and do great things. You alone are God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me Your way, O Lord. I will walk in Your truth. May my heart fear Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord my God, I will give thanks to You with all my heart. I will bring honor to Your name forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Your loving-kindness toward me is great. And You have saved my soul from the bottom of the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God, proud men have come up against me. A group of fighting men want to take my life. And they do not think of You.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You, O Lord, are a God full of love and pity. You are slow to anger and rich in loving-kindness and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn to me, and show me loving-kindness. Give Your strength to Your servant. And save the son of your woman servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me something special to see of Your favor. Then those who hate me may see it and be ashamed. Because You, O Lord, have helped me and comforted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city God built stands on the holy mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord loves the gates of Zion more than all the other places of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great things are said about you, O city of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say that Rahab and Babylon are among those who know Me. Look, Philistia and Tyre and Ethiopia say, “This one was born there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But it will be said of Zion, “This one and that one were born in her.” And the Most High Himself will make her strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will write in the book of the people, “This one was born there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then those who sing and those who play music will say, “All my wells of joy are in you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, the God Who saves me, I have cried out before You day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my prayer come to You. Listen to my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my soul is filled with troubles. And my life comes near the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am added among those who go down into the deep hole. I am like a man without strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am left among the dead, like those who have been killed and lie in the grave, whom You remember no more. They are cut off from Your help.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have put me in the deepest hole, in a dark and deep place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your anger has rested upon me. And You have troubled me with all Your waves.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have taken my good friends far from me. You have made me hated by them. I am shut in and cannot go out.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes have become weak because of trouble. I have called to You every day, O Lord. I have spread out my hands to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will You show Your great works to the dead? Will the dead rise and praise You?
speaker: Narrator

text: Will Your loving-kindness be told about in the grave, and how faithful You are in the place that destroys?
speaker: Narrator

text: Will Your great works be known in the darkness, and Your right and good works in the land where all is forgotten?
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have cried to You for help, O Lord. My prayer comes to You in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, why do You turn away from me? Why do You hide Your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been troubled and near death since I was young. I have suffered Your punishment. And I cannot win.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your burning anger has passed over me. The punishment You have sent destroys me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gather around me like water all day long. Together they close in upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have taken my friend and loved one far from me. Friends that were near to me are in darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing of the loving-kindness of the Lord forever. I will make known with my mouth how faithful You are to all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I said, “Loving-kindness will be built up forever. You will make known how faithful You are in the heavens.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You said, “I have made an agreement with My chosen one. I have promised to David, Your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make your seed last forever. I will build up your throne for all the children-to-come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, the heavens will praise Your great works and how faithful You are in the meeting of the holy ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who in the heavens is like the Lord? Who among the sons of the powerful is like the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: God is honored with fear in the meeting of the holy ones. He is honored with fear more than all who are around Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord God of all, powerful Lord, who is like You? All around You we see how faithful You are.
speaker: Narrator

text: You rule over the rising sea. When its waves rise, You quiet them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have crushed Rahab like one who is killed. You have destroyed those who hate You with Your powerful arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens are Yours; and the earth is Yours. You have made the world and all that is in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made from nothing the north and the south. Tabor and Hermon call out for joy at Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have a strong arm. Your hand is powerful. Your right hand is honored.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your throne stands on what is right and fair. Loving-kindness and truth go before You.
speaker: Narrator

text: How happy are the people who know the sound of joy! They walk in the light of Your face, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are full of joy in Your name all day long. And by being right with You, they are honored.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You are the shining-greatness of their strength. And our horn is lifted high by Your favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our safe-covering belongs to the Lord. And our king belongs to the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once You spoke in a special dream to Your faithful ones, saying: “I have given help to a powerful one. I have honored a chosen one from among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have found David, Your servant. I have poured My holy oil upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: My hand will stay with him. And My arm will give him strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who hate him will not fool him. No sinful man will bring trouble to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he will see Me crush those who fight against him. I will kill those who hate him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be faithful and My loving-kindness will be with him. And in My name he will become great.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set his hand on the sea also, and his right hand on the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will cry to Me, ‘You are my Father, my God, and the rock that saves me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make him My first-born also, the highest of the kings of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will keep My loving-kindness for him forever. And My agreement with him will be made strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make his seed last forever. And his throne will last as long as heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If his sons leave My Law and do not do what I say,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if they break My Laws and do not obey My Word,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will punish their sin with the stick, and their wrong-doing with the whip.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will not take my loving-kindness from him. I will always be faithful to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not break My agreement, or change what was spoken by My lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once I have promised by My holy name, I will not lie to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: His seed will last forever. And his throne will last before Me like the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will last forever like the moon, which may always be seen in the sky.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But You have thrown off and turned away from Your chosen one. You have been full of anger against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have hated the agreement with Your servant. You have made his crown dirty in the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have broken down all his walls. You have destroyed his strong places.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who pass on the road rob him. He has become a shame to his neighbors.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have honored the right hand of those who fight against him. You have made all who hate him glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have turned away the sharp part of his sword. And You have not made him stand in a fight.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have put an end to what shows of his greatness, and have thrown his throne to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have made him old before his time, and have covered him with shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long, O Lord? Will You hide Yourself forever? Will Your anger burn like fire?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember how fast my life is passing. You have made all men for nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: What man can live and not see death? Can he save himself from the power of the grave?
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, where is the loving-kindness You used to have, that You promised in faith to David?
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, remember the shame of those who work for You. Remember how I carry near my heart the shame of all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who hate You have put us to shame, O Lord. They have put to shame the footsteps of Your chosen one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord forever! Let it be so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, You have been the place of comfort for all people of all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the mountains were born, before You gave birth to the earth and the world, forever and ever, You are God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You change man into dust again, and say, “Return, O children of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For a thousand years in Your eyes are like yesterday when it passes by, or like the hours of the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: You carry men away as with a flood. They fall asleep. In the morning they are like the new grass that grows.
speaker: Narrator

text: It grows well in the morning, but dries up and dies by evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are burned up by Your anger. By Your anger we are troubled and afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have set our wrong-doing before You, our secret sins in the light of Your face.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all our days pass away in Your anger. We finish our years with a quiet cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days of our life are seventy years, or eighty if we have the strength. Yet the best of them are only hard work and sorrow. For they are soon gone and we fly away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who understands the power of Your anger? Your anger is as great as the fear that we should have for You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach us to understand how many days we have. Then we will have a heart of wisdom to give You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, O Lord. How long will it be? Have pity upon those who work for You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fill us in the morning with Your loving-kindness. Let us sing for joy and be glad all our days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make us glad for as many days as You have made us suffer, and for the years we have seen trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Your work be shown to Your servants. And let Your wonderful greatness be shown to their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us. And make the work of our hands stand strong. Yes, make the work of our hands stand strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who lives in the safe place of the Most High will be in the shadow of the All-powerful.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say to the Lord, “You are my safe and strong place, my God, in Whom I trust.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is He Who takes you away from the trap, and from the killing sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will cover you with His wings. And under His wings you will be safe. He is faithful like a safe-covering and a strong wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will not be afraid of trouble at night, or of the arrow that flies by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will not be afraid of the sickness that walks in darkness, or of the trouble that destroys at noon.
speaker: Narrator

text: A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand. But it will not come near you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will only look on with your eyes, and see how the sinful are punished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you have made the Lord your safe place, and the Most High the place where you live,
speaker: Narrator

text: nothing will hurt you. No trouble will come near your tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He will tell His angels to care for you and keep you in all your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will hold you up in their hands. So your foot will not hit against a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will walk upon the lion and the snake. You will crush under your feet the young lion and the snake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he has loved Me, I will bring him out of trouble. I will set him in a safe place on high, because he has known My name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will call upon Me, and I will answer him. I will be with him in trouble. I will take him out of trouble and honor him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will please him with a long life. And I will show him My saving power.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is good to give thanks to the Lord, and sing praises to Your name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is good to tell of Your loving-kindness in the morning, and of how faithful You are at night,
speaker: Narrator

text: with harps, and with music of praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You have made me glad by what You have done, O Lord. I will sing for joy at the works of Your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: How great are Your works, O Lord! How deep are Your thoughts!
speaker: Narrator

text: A man who cannot reason does not have much learning. A fool does not understand this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even if the sinful grow up like grass and all goes well with wrong-doers, they will be destroyed forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You, O Lord, rule from Your high place forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, look, those who hate You will be lost from You forever, O Lord. All those who do wrong will be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You have lifted up my horn like that of a wild bull. New oil has been poured upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes have seen those who wait to hurt me. My ears hear the bad men who rise up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who is right and good will grow like the palm tree. He will grow like a tall tree in Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Planted in the house of the Lord, they will grow well in the home of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will still give fruit when they are old. They will be full of life and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will show that the Lord is faithful. He is my rock. There is nothing in Him that is not right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord rules. He is dressed with great power. The Lord has dressed Himself with strength. For sure, the world is built to last. It will not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your throne is set up from long ago. You have always been.
speaker: Narrator

text: The floods have lifted up, O Lord. The floods have lifted up their voice. The floods lift up their beating waves.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord on high is more powerful than the sound of many waters and the strong waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Word is very sure. O Lord, Your house is holy forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, the God Who punishes, God Who punishes, let Your light shine!
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, You Judge of the earth. Pay what is owed to the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long will the sinful, O Lord, how long will the sinful be full of joy?
speaker: Narrator

text: They pour out proud words. All those who do wrong, talk about themselves as if they are great people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They crush Your people, O Lord. They bring trouble upon Your chosen nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They kill the woman whose husband has died and the stranger. They kill the children who have no parents.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they say, “The Lord does not see. The God of Jacob does not care.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen, you foolish ones among the people. You fools, when will you understand?
speaker: Narrator

text: He Who made the ear, does He not hear? He Who made the eye, does He not see?
speaker: Narrator

text: He Who punishes nations so they might give up sin, will He not speak strong words to them? Is He not the One Who teaches man all he knows?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord knows the thoughts of man. He knows that they are empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is the man who is punished until he gives up sin, O Lord, and whom You teach from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: You give him rest from days of trouble, until a hole is dug for the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord will not turn away from His people. He will not leave His chosen nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what is decided will be right and good. And all those whose hearts are right will follow it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will rise up for me against the sinful? Who will take a stand for me against those who do wrong?
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord had not been my help, my soul would soon have been among the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I said, “My foot is going out from under me,” Your loving-kindness held me up, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my worry is great within me, Your comfort brings joy to my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Can a sinful throne that brings trouble by its laws be a friend to You?
speaker: Narrator

text: They join together against the life of those who are right and good. They send those who are not guilty to their death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord has been my strong place, my God, and the rock where I am safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has brought back their own sin upon them and will destroy them for their wrong-doing. The Lord our God will destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, let us sing with joy to the Lord. Let us sing loud with joy to the rock Who saves us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us come before Him giving thanks. Let us make a sound of joy to Him with songs.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: The deep places of the earth are in His hand. And the tops of the mountains belong to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea is His, for He made it. And His hands made the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, let us bow down in worship. Let us get down on our knees before the Lord Who made us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He is our God. And we are the people of His field, and the sheep of His hand. If you hear His voice today,
speaker: Narrator

text: do not let your hearts become hard as you did at Meribah, as you did that day at Massah in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your early fathers put Me to the test and tried Me. But they had seen the work I did.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was angry with the people of that day for forty years. I said, “They always think wrong thoughts. And they do not know My ways.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I was angry with them and said, “They will never go into My rest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to the Lord a new song. Let all the earth sing to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to the Lord. Honor His name. Make His saving power known from day to day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell of His shining-greatness among the nations. Tell of His wonderful works among all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is great and should be given much praise. He is to be honored with fear above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the gods of the nations are false gods. But the Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and great power are with Him. Strength and beauty are in His holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to the Lord, O families of the nations, give to the Lord the honor and strength that He should have.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to the Lord the honor of His name. Bring a gift and come into His holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Worship the Lord in holy clothing. May all the earth shake in fear before Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say among the nations that the Lord rules. The world is built to last. It will not be moved. He will be right when He says who is guilty or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the heavens be glad. And let the earth be full of joy. Let the sea and all that is in it make a loud noise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the fields and all that is in them be full of joy. Then all the trees of the land will sing for joy
speaker: Narrator

text: before the Lord. For He is coming. He is coming to say who is guilty or not on the earth. He will be right in what He decides about the world. And He will be faithful to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord rules. Let the earth be full of joy. Let the many islands be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Clouds and darkness are all around Him. His throne is built upon what is right and fair.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fire goes before Him and burns up those who hate Him on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text: His lightning lights up the world. The earth sees, and shakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains melt like a candle before the Lord, before the Lord of the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens tell about how right and good He is. And all the people see His shining-greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all those who serve false gods be ashamed, those who talk about how great their gods are. Worship Him, all you gods!
speaker: Narrator

text: Zion heard this and was glad. The people of Judah have been full of joy because of what You decide, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You are the Lord Most High over all the earth. You are honored above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who love the Lord hate what is bad. For He keeps safe the souls of His faithful ones. He takes them away from the hand of the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Light is spread like seed for those who are right and good, and joy for the pure in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be glad in the Lord, you who are right and good. Give thanks to His holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing a new song to the Lord. For He has done great things. His right hand and His holy arm have won the fight for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has made His saving power known. He has shown to the nations how right and good He is.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has shown His loving-kindness and how beautiful He is to the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the saving power of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Call out for joy to the Lord, all the earth. Sing out loud songs of joy and sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises to the Lord with harps, with harps and the voice of singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Call out for joy with the sound of horns before the King, the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sea and all that is in it make a loud noise, and the world and all who live in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the rivers clap their hands. Let the mountains sing together for joy
speaker: Narrator

text: before the Lord. For He is coming to say who is guilty or not on the earth. He will be right in what He decides about the world. And He will be fair to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord rules! Let the people shake in fear! He sits on His throne above the angels. Let the earth shake!
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is great in Zion. And He is honored above all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise Your great name. It is to be honored with fear. He is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text: The strength of the King loves what is right. You have set up what is fair. You do what is right and fair in Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor the Lord our God. Worship at His feet. For He is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron were among His religious leaders. And Samuel was among those who called on His name. They called upon the Lord, and He answered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke to them from the cloud. They kept His Word and the Law that He gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our God, You answered them. You were a forgiving God to them. But You punished them for their wrong-doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor the Lord our God. And worship at His holy mountain. For the Lord our God is holy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Call out with joy to the Lord, all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be glad as you serve the Lord. Come before Him with songs of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know that the Lord is God. It is He Who made us, and not we ourselves. We are His people and the sheep of His field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go into His gates giving thanks and into His holy place with praise. Give thanks to Him. Honor His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever. And He is faithful to all people and to all their children-to-come.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing of loving-kindness and of what is right and fair. I will sing praises to You, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be careful to live a life without blame. When will You come to me? I will walk within my house with a right and good heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set no sinful thing in front of my eyes. I hate the work of those who are not faithful. It will not get hold of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sinful heart will be far from me. I will have nothing to do with sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will stop whoever talks against his neighbor in secret. I will not listen to anyone who has a proud look and a proud heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes will look with favor on the faithful in the land, so they may serve me. He who walks without blame will help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He whose ways are false will not live in my house. He who tells lies will not stand in front of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will destroy all the sinful in the land every morning. I will cut off all those who do wrong from the city of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O Lord! Let my cry for help come to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not hide Your face from me in the day of my trouble. Turn Your ear to me. Hurry to answer me in the day when I call.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my days go up in smoke. And my bones are burned as with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart is crushed and dried like grass. And I forget to eat my food.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am nothing but skin and bones because of my loud cries.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am like a pelican in the desert. I am like an owl of the waste places.
speaker: Narrator

text: I lie awake. And I feel like a bird alone on the roof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who hate me have made it hard for me all day long. Those who are angry with me curse my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have eaten ashes like bread and have mixed my drink with tears,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of Your great anger. For You have lifted me up and thrown me away.
speaker: Narrator

text: My days are like the evening shadow. I dried up like grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You and Your name, O Lord, will always be forever and to all people for all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will rise up and have loving-pity on Zion. For it is time to show favor to her. The set time has come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Your servants respect her stones and show pity for her dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The nations will fear the name of the Lord. All the kings of the earth will fear Your shining-greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord has built up Zion. He will come in His shining-greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will answer the prayer of those in need. He will not turn from their prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will be written for the children-to-come. So a people not yet born may give thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He looked down from His holy place. He watched the earth from heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: to hear the loud cries of those in prison and to set free those who are being sent to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the name of the Lord will be made known in Zion and His praise in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: when the people gather together and the nations gather to serve the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has taken away my strength. He has taken days from my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, “O my God, do not take me away when my days are only half done. Your years go on to all people of all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: You made the earth in the beginning. You made the heavens with Your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will be destroyed but You will always live. They will all become old as clothing becomes old. You will change them like a coat. And they will be changed,
speaker: Narrator

text: but You are always the same. Your years will never end.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of those who work for You will live on. And their children will be set before You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, O my soul. And all that is within me, praise His holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, O my soul. And forget none of His acts of kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He forgives all my sins. He heals all my diseases.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saves my life from the grave. He crowns me with loving-kindness and pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: He fills my years with good things and I am made young again like the eagle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord does what is right and fair for all who suffer under a bad power.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made His ways known to Moses and His acts to the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is full of loving-pity and kindness. He is slow to anger and has much loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not always keep after us. And He will not keep His anger back forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has not punished us enough for all our sins. He has not paid us back for all our wrong-doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: For His loving-kindness for those who fear Him is as great as the heavens are high above the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has taken our sins from us as far as the east is from the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has loving-pity on those who fear Him, as a father has loving-pity on his children.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He knows what we are made of. He remembers that we are dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days of man are like grass. He grows like a flower of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wind blows over it, it is gone. Its place will remember it no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the loving-kindness of the Lord is forever and forever on those who fear Him. And what is right with God is given forever to their children’s children,
speaker: Narrator

text: to those who keep His agreement and remember to obey His Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has set up His throne in the heavens. And His holy nation rules over all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, you powerful angels of His who do what He says, obeying His voice as He speaks!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, all you armies of His who work for Him and do what pleases Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, all His works in all places under His rule. Praise the Lord, O my soul!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, O my soul! O Lord my God, You are very great. You are dressed with great honor and wonderful power.
speaker: Narrator

text: He covers Himself with light as with a coat. He spreads out the heavens like a tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes His home on the waters. He makes the clouds His wagon. He rides on the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes the winds carry His news. He makes His helpers a burning fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set the earth in its place so that it will stay that way forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: You covered it with the sea as with a coat. The waters stood above the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters left at Your strong words. They went away in a hurry at the sound of Your thunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains went up and the valleys went down to the place that You made for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You set a place that they may not pass over. The waters will never cover the earth again.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sends rivers into the valleys. They flow between the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: They give water to all the animals of the field. The wild donkeys drink until they are no longer thirsty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The birds of the sky nest beside them. They sing among the branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: He waters the mountains from His home above. The earth is filled with the fruit of His works.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes the grass grow for the cattle, and plants for man to use. So He may bring food from the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: wine that makes man’s heart glad, oil to make his face shine, and food to make his heart strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tall cedar trees that the Lord planted in Lebanon drink their fill.
speaker: Narrator

text: The birds make their nests there. The stork has its nest in the green trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high mountains are for the wild goats. The rocks are a safe place for the badgers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the moon to mark the time of year. And the sun knows when to go down.
speaker: Narrator

text: You make darkness and it becomes night. Then all the wild animals among the trees come out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lions make a loud noise as they go after meat. And they get their food from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They go to their homes and lie down when the sun rises.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then man goes out to his work and works until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, how many are Your works! You made them all in wisdom. The earth is full of what You have made.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is the wide sea full of both large and small animals. There are too many for us to number.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ships sail there. And the very large sea animal You have made plays in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all wait for You to give them their food at the right time.
speaker: Narrator

text: You give it to them and they gather it up. You open Your hand and they are filled with good things.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are troubled and afraid when You hide Your face. And when You take away their breath, they die and return to the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are made when You send Your Spirit. And You make the land of the earth new again.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the shining-greatness of the Lord last forever. May the Lord be glad in His works.
speaker: Narrator

text: He looks at the earth and it shakes with fear. He touches the mountains and they smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing to the Lord all my life. I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the words of my heart be pleasing to Him. As for me, I will be glad in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let sinners be destroyed from the earth. And let the sinful be no more. Honor the Lord, O my soul! Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: O give thanks to the Lord. Call on His name. Make His works known among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to Him. Sing praises to Him. Tell of all His great works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor His holy name. Let the heart of those who look to the Lord be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look for the Lord and His strength. Look for His face all the time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the great and powerful works that He has done. Keep in mind what He has decided and told us,
speaker: Narrator

text: O children of His servant Abraham, O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the Lord our God. What He has decided is in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has remembered His agreement forever, the promise He made to last through a thousand families-to-come,
speaker: Narrator

text: the agreement that He made with Abraham, and His promise to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave it to Jacob as a Law, to Israel as an agreement that will last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “I will give the land of Canaan to you as your share,”
speaker: Narrator

text: when they were only a few men in number and were strangers in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from nation to nation, from the people under one king to the people under another.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not allow anyone to hold power over them. And He spoke sharp words to kings because of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Do not touch My chosen ones. And do not hurt those who speak for Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He called for a time of no food on the land. He cut off all their bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent a man, Joseph, before them who was sold as a servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: They hurt his feet with chains. He was put in irons,
speaker: Narrator

text: until what he had said would happen came to pass. The Word of the Lord tested him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king sent and had him taken out of prison. The ruler of many people set him free.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made him the lord of his house and ruler over all he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: He could punish the rulers as he pleased. And he taught wisdom to the wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel also came into Egypt. So Jacob stayed in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He made the number of His people grow until they were stronger than those who held power over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He turned their hearts to hate His people and to make plans against His servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent Moses, His servant, and Aaron whom He had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did His great works for them to see, powerful works in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent darkness and made the land dark. They did not fight against what He told them to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: He changed their water into blood, so their fish died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their land became covered with frogs, even in the rooms of their kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke and there came many flies all over their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave them hail instead of rain, and lightning like fire in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: He destroyed their vines and fig trees and the trees of their country.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke and the locusts came. There were too many to number.
speaker: Narrator

text: They ate up all the plants in their country. They ate all the fruit of their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed all the first-born in their land, the first fruits of all their strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He brought Israel out with silver and gold. And there was not one weak person among their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Egypt was glad when they left. For they had become afraid of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spread a cloud for a covering, and fire to give light at night.
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked, and He brought them quails for meat. And He filled them with the bread of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: He opened the rock and water flowed out. It flowed in the desert like a river.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He remembered His holy Word with Abraham His servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He brought His people out with joy, His chosen ones with singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave them the lands of the nations. They were given what others had worked for,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that they might do what He told them and keep His Law. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! O give thanks to the Lord for He is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can put into words the great works of the Lord? Who can make known all His praise?
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are those who are faithful in being fair and who always do what is right and good!
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, remember me when You show favor to Your people. Visit me also when You save them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I may share in the well-being of Your chosen ones. So I may share in the joy of Your nation, and be proud of Your people.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have sinned like our fathers. We have done wrong. We have been sinful in our actions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers in Egypt did not understand Your powerful works. They did not remember how many times You showed Your loving-kindness. But they turned against You by the sea, the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet He saved them because of the honor of His name, and to make His great power known.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He spoke sharp words to the Red Sea and it dried up. And He led them through the sea as through a desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saved them from the hand of those who hated them. He set them free from the hand of those who went against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters covered those who hated them. Not one of them was left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they believed His promises. They sang His praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they soon forgot His works. They did not wait to hear what He wanted them to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: They wanted many things in the desert, and they tempted God there.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He gave them what they wanted, but He allowed their souls to become weak because of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were jealous of Moses in the place where they set up their tents. And they were jealous of Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the earth opened up and swallowed Dathan. It closed over the group of Abiram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a fire came among their followers. It burned up the sinful people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made a calf at Horeb and worshiped a god of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traded their shining-greatness for something that looked like a bull that eats grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: They forgot the God Who saved them, Who had done great things in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: powerful works in the land of Ham, and works that brought fear by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He said that He would destroy them. But Moses, His chosen one, stood in the way to keep His anger from destroying them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they hated the good land. They did not believe in His Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they complained in their tents. They did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He swore to them that He would let them die in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He would spread out their children among the nations and divide them over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They joined themselves to Baal of Peor and ate gifts given to the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made the Lord angry by their actions and a sickness broke out among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Phinehas stood up and came between them, and the sickness was stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this made him right with God to all people forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also made the Lord angry at the waters of Meribah. And trouble came to Moses because of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke from his lips without thinking because they went against the Spirit of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not destroy the people as the Lord told them to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they mixed with the nations and learned their ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: They served their gods, which became a trap to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They even gave their sons and daughters as gifts on an altar to the demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: They poured out the blood of those who were not guilty, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they gave on an altar to the gods of Canaan. And the land was poisoned with blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made themselves unclean by what they did. They were not true to God in what they did.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord was angry with His people. He hated His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He handed them over to the nations. And those who hated them ruled over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who hated them held a strong power over them. And they were made to obey them.
speaker: Narrator

text: God set them free many times. But they always turned against Him and went deeper into sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He looked upon their trouble when He heard their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He remembered His agreement because of them, and took pity on them by the greatness of His loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who held them also saw how God took pity on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our God, save us! Gather us from among the nations. And we will give thanks to Your holy name and find honor in Your praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and thanks be to the Lord, the God of Israel, forever and ever. Let all the people say, “Let it be so!” Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to the Lord for He is good! His loving-kindness lasts forever!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the people who have been saved say so. He has bought them and set them free from the hand of those who hated them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gathered them from the lands, from east and west, from north and south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some traveled through the desert wastes. They did not find a way to a city where they could live.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were hungry and thirsty. Their souls became weak within them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble. And He took them out of their suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text: He led them by a straight path to a city where they could live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them give thanks to the Lord for His loving-kindness and His great works to the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: For He fills the thirsty soul. And He fills the hungry soul with good things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death. They suffered in prison in iron chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they had turned against the Words of God. They hated what the Most High told them to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He loaded them down with hard work. They fell and there was no one to help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble. And He saved them from their suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death. And He broke their chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them give thanks to the Lord for His loving-kindness and His great works to the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: For He has broken gates of brass and cut through walls of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some were fools because of their wrong-doing. They had troubles because of their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: They hated all kinds of food. And they came near the gates of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble. And He saved them from their suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent His Word and healed them. And He saved them from the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them give thanks to the Lord for His loving-kindness and His great works to the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them give Him gifts of thanks and tell of His works with songs of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some went out to sea in ships to buy and sell on the great waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have seen what the Lord can do and His great works on the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He spoke and raised up a storm that lifted up the waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went up to the heavens and down to the deep. Their strength of heart left them in their danger.
speaker: Narrator

text: They could not walk straight but went from side to side like a drunk man. They did not know what to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble. And He took them out of all their problems.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stopped the storm, and the waves of the sea became quiet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they were glad because the sea became quiet. And He led them to the safe place they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them give thanks to the Lord for His loving-kindness and His great works to the children of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them honor Him in the meeting of the people and praise Him in the meeting of the leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: He changes rivers into a desert and wells of water into a thirsty ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: He changes a land of much fruit into a salt waste because of the sin of those who live in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He changes a desert into a pool of water and makes water flow out of dry ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He makes the hungry go there so they may build a city to live in.
speaker: Narrator

text: They plant seeds in the fields and plant grape-vines and gather much fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lets good come to them and they become many in number. And He does not let the number of their cattle become less.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the number of people becomes less and they are put to shame under a bad power and trouble and sorrow,
speaker: Narrator

text: He pours anger on rulers. He makes them walk in the waste places where there is no path.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He lifts those in need out of their troubles. He makes their families grow like flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who are right see it and are glad. But all the sinful shut their mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the wise man think about these things. And may he think about the loving-kindness of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart will not be moved, O God. I will sing. Yes, I will sing praises with my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wake up, different kinds of harps. I will wake up the new day.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give thanks to You among the people, O Lord. I will sing praises to You among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Your loving-kindness is great above the heavens. And Your truth can touch the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be lifted up high above the heavens, O God. Let Your shining-greatness be over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Save us with Your right hand and answer me. Let Your loved ones be set free.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has said in His holy place: “I will be full of joy. I will divide Shechem and the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gilead is Mine. Manasseh is Mine. Ephraim is the covering for My head. Judah is My law giver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab is where I wash My hands. I will throw My shoe over Edom. I will call out over Philistia that I have won.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have You not turned away from us, O God? And will You not go out with our armies, O God?
speaker: Narrator

text: O give us help against those who hate us. For the help of man is worth nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: With God’s help we will do great things. And He will break under His feet those who fight against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give praise to You, O God. Do not be quiet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sinners and liars have opened their mouths against me. They have spoken against me with lying tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have gathered around me with words of hate. They fought against me for no reason.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give them my love but they speak against me in return. But I am in prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: They pay me what is bad for what is good. They give me hate for my love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a sinful man have power over him. Let one who speaks against him stand at his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he is tried, let him be found guilty. And may his prayer become sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let his days be few. Let another person take over his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let his children be without a father. And let his wife be without a husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: May his children go around begging. And may they look for food far from their destroyed homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the one to whom he owes money take all that he has. May strangers take away all he has worked for.
speaker: Narrator

text: May no one show him kindness. Let no one pity his children who have no father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let his children be cut off. Do not let their family name be remembered by the people-to-come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sins of his fathers be remembered by the Lord, and do not let the sins of his mother be forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: May these sins always be before the Lord. So He may not let them be remembered on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he did not remember to show loving-kindness. Instead he made it hard for the poor and those in need and those with a broken heart. He even put them to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: He loved to curse others, so may it come to him. He did not like to have good come to others, so good was far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He dressed himself with cursing as with a coat. They came into his body like water and into his bones like oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: May they be like clothing that covers him and like a belt that he always wears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let this be what the Lord pays to those who speak against me and wish bad things would happen to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But You, O God, the Lord, be kind to me because of Your name. Take me out of trouble because Your loving-kindness is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am in trouble and in need. And my heart is hurt within me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am passing like an evening shadow. I am shaken off like a locust.
speaker: Narrator

text: My knees are weak from going without food. And my body has lost all its fat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Others laugh at me. They look at me and shake their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Help me, O Lord my God! Save me by Your loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them know that this is Your hand and that You, O Lord, have done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them hope that bad things will happen. But You make good things happen. Let them be ashamed when they rise up against me. But let Your servant be full of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who speak against me be dressed with shame. Let them cover themselves with shame as with a coat.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give thanks to the Lord in a loud voice. I will praise Him among many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He stands at the right hand of the one in need to save him from those who judge his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord says to my Lord, “Sit at My right side, for those who hate You will be a place to rest Your feet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will send out Your strength from Zion, saying, “Rule in front of those who hate You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Your people will be willing to help in the day of Your power. Your young men will be dressed in holy clothes. They will come to You like water on the grass in the early morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has sworn and will not change His mind: “You are a Religious Leader forever, in the same way as Melchizedek.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is at Your right hand. He will crush kings in the day of His anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will say who is guilty or not among the nations. He will fill them with dead bodies. He will crush the leaders of many lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will drink from the river on the way. And so He will lift up His head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! I will give thanks to the Lord with all my heart where those who are right with God gather together and in the meeting of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The works of the Lord are great. All who find joy in them try to understand them.
speaker: Narrator

text: His work is great and powerful. And He is right and good forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has made His great works to be remembered. The Lord shows loving-favor and pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives food to those who fear Him. He will remember His agreement forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has shown His people the power of His works by giving them the land of other nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The works of His hands are faithful and right. All His Laws are true.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stand strong forever and ever. They are done by what is true and right.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has made a way for His people to be free. He has set up His agreement forever. His holy name is to be honored with fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. All who obey His Laws have good understanding. His praise lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! How happy is the man who honors the Lord with fear and finds joy in His Law!
speaker: Narrator

text: His children will be powerful in the land. Each family who is right will be happy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Riches and well-being are in his house. And his right-standing with God will last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Light rises even in darkness for the one who is right. He is kind and has loving-pity and does what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good will come to the man who is ready to give much, and fair in what he does.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will never be shaken. The man who is right and good will be remembered forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not be afraid of bad news. His heart is strong because he trusts in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: His heart will not be shaken. He will not be afraid and will watch those lose who fight against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has given much to the poor. His right-standing with God lasts forever. His horn will be lifted high in honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful man will see it and be troubled and angry. He will grind his teeth and waste away. The desire of the sinful will come to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! Praise Him, O you who serve the Lord. Praise the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the name of the Lord be honored, now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the Lord is to be praised from the time the sun rises to when it sets.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is high above all nations. His shining-greatness is above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is like the Lord our God? He sits on His throne on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: He looks down upon the heavens and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He raises the poor from the dust. He lifts those in need from the ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes them sit with rulers, with the rulers of His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives a home to the woman who could not give birth and makes her the mother of children. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel came out of Egypt. The house of Jacob came from a people who spoke a strange language.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah became His holy place, and Israel became the place of His rule.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea looked and ran away. The Jordan turned back.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains jumped like sheep, the hills like lambs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why did you try to get away, O sea? Why did you turn back, O Jordan?
speaker: Narrator

text: O mountains, why did you jump like sheep? O hills, why did you jump like lambs?
speaker: Narrator

text: Shake in fear before the Lord, O earth, before the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: He changed the rock into a pool of water. He made water flow out of hard rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let honor be given to Your name and not to us, O Lord, not to us. Because You are loving and kind and faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God now?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But our God is in the heavens. He does whatever He wants to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their gods are silver and gold, the work of human hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have mouths but they cannot speak. They have eyes but they cannot see.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have ears but they cannot hear. They have noses but they cannot smell.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have hands but they cannot feel. They have feet but they cannot walk. They cannot make a sound come out of their mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who make them and trust them will be like them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Israel, trust in the Lord. He is their help and safe-covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord. He is their help and safe-covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord. He is their help and safe-covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has remembered us and will make good come to us. He will make good come to the house of Israel. He will make good come to the house of Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will make good come to those who fear the Lord, both the small and the great.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord make your numbers grow, both you and your children.
speaker: Narrator

text: May you be given good things by the Lord, the Maker of heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heavens belong to the Lord. But He has given the earth to the children of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead do not praise the Lord. Neither do those who go down into the quiet place.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will give honor and thanks to the Lord, now and forever. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: I love the Lord, because He hears my voice and my prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will call on Him as long as I live, because He has turned His ear to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The strings of death are all around me. And the fear of the grave came upon me. I suffered with trouble and sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I called on the name of the Lord: “O Lord, I beg You, save my life!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is loving and right. Yes, our God is full of loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord takes care of the child-like. I was brought down, and He saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return to your rest, O my soul. For the Lord has been good to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You, O Lord, have saved my soul from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will walk with the Lord in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: I believed when I said, “I am very troubled.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I said in my fear, “All men are liars.”
speaker: Narrator

text: What should I give to the Lord for all the good things He has done for me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will show Him my thanks for saving me with a gift of wine and praise His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will keep my promises to the Lord before all His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The death of His holy ones is of great worth in the eyes of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure I am Your servant, O Lord. I am Your servant, the son of the woman who served You. You have set me free from my chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give a gift of thanks to You and call on the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will keep my promises to the Lord before all His people,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the holy place of the Lord, and in the center of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, all nations! Praise Him, all people!
speaker: Narrator

text: For His loving-kindness toward us is great. And the truth of the Lord lasts forever. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel say, “His loving-kindness lasts forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the house of Aaron say, “His loving-kindness lasts forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who fear the Lord say, “His loving-kindness lasts forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried to the Lord in my trouble, and He answered me and put me in a good place.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is with me. I will not be afraid of what man can do to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is with me. He is my Helper. I will watch those lose who fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to trust in the Lord than to trust in man.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to trust in the Lord than to trust in rulers.
speaker: Narrator

text: All nations gathered around me. But I cut them off in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gathered around me. Yes, they were on every side. But I cut them off in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all around me like bees and they died out fast like burning thorns. I will destroy them in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: You pushed me back so that I was falling, but the Lord helped me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my strength and my song. He is the One Who saves me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The joy of being saved is being heard in the tents of those who are right and good. The right hand of the Lord does powerful things.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord’s right hand is lifted high. The right hand of the Lord does powerful things.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not die but live. And I will tell of what the Lord has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has punished me but He has not given me over to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open to me the gates of what is right and good. I will go through them and give thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the gate of the Lord. Those who are right with God will pass through it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give thanks to You, for You have answered me. And You are the One Who saves me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stone that was put aside by the workmen has become the most important stone in the building.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has done this. We think it is great!
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the day that the Lord has made. Let us be full of joy and be glad in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, we beg You to save us! O Lord, we ask that You let everything go well for us!
speaker: Narrator

text: Great and honored is he who comes in the name of the Lord. We honor you from the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is God. He has given us light. Tie the gift with rope to the horns of the altar on this special day.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are my God and I will give You thanks. You are my God and I will praise You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are those whose way is without blame, who walk in the Law of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are those who keep His Law and look for Him with all their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also do not sin, but walk in His ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have set down Laws that we should always obey.
speaker: Narrator

text: O, that my ways may be always in keeping with Your Law!
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will not be put to shame when I respect Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise You with a heart that is right when I learn how right You judge.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will obey Your Law. Do not leave me all alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can a young man keep his way pure? By living by Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have looked for You with all my heart. Do not let me turn from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Word have I hid in my heart, that I may not sin against You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great and honored are You, O Lord. Teach me Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have told with my lips of all the Laws of Your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have found as much joy in following Your Law as one finds in much riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will think about Your Law and have respect for Your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad in Your Law. I will not forget Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do good to Your servant so I may live and obey Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open my eyes so that I may see great things from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a stranger on the earth. Do not hide Your Word from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is crushed with a desire for Your Law at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text: You speak sharp words to the proud, the hated ones, because they turn from Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take away shame and bad feelings from me, for I have kept Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even if rulers sit together and speak against me, Your servant thinks about Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Law is my joy and it tells me what to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul is laid in the dust. Give me new life because of Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have told about my ways, and You have answered me. Teach me Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me understand the way of Your Law so I will talk about Your great works.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul cries because of sorrow. Give me strength because of Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the false way from me. Show Your loving-favor by giving me Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have chosen the faithful way. I have set Your Law in front of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hold on to Your Law, O Lord. Do not put me to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will run the way of Your Law, for You will give me a willing heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, teach me the way of Your Law and I will obey it to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me understanding. Then I will listen to Your Word and obey it with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make me walk in the path of Your Word, for I find joy in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn my heart toward Your Law, so I will not earn money in a wrong way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn my eyes away from things that have no worth, and give me new life because of Your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep Your promise to Your servant, the promise You made to those who fear and worship You.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn away the shame that I do not want to come to me, for Your Law is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: O, how I desire Your Law! Give me new life because of Your right and good way.
speaker: Narrator

text: May Your loving-kindness also come to me, O Lord. May You save me as Your Word says.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will have an answer for the one who puts me to shame, for I trust in Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not take the word of truth out of my mouth, for I hope in Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will always obey Your Law, forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will walk as a free man, for I look for Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will speak of Your Law in front of kings and will not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be glad in Your Law, which I love.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lift up my hands to Your Word, which I love, and I will think about Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Your Word to Your servant, for You have given me hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Word has given me new life. This is my comfort in my suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud always laugh at me, but I do not turn away from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have remembered Your Law from a long time ago, O Lord, and I am comforted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Burning anger comes upon me because of the sinful who turn away from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Laws are my songs in whatever house I stay.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remember Your name in the night, O Lord, and I have kept Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: It has become my way to obey Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my share. I have promised to obey Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I begged for Your favor with all my heart. Show me Your love because of Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thought about my ways and turned my steps to Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hurried and did not wait to obey Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ropes of the sinful are all around me, but I have not forgotten Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will rise late in the night to give thanks to You because Your Law is right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am a friend to all who fear You and of those who keep Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth is full of Your loving-kindness, O Lord. Teach me Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have done good to Your servant, O Lord, because of Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me what I should know to be right and fair for I believe in Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before I suffered I went the wrong way, but now I obey Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are good and You do good. Teach me Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have put together a lie against me. I will keep Your Law with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their heart is covered with fat, but I find joy in Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is good for me that I was troubled, so that I might learn Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Law of Your mouth is better to me than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your hands made me and put me together. Give me understanding to learn Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: May those who fear You see me and be glad, for I have put my hope in Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I know that what You decide is right and good. You punish me because You are faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: May Your loving-kindness comfort me because of Your promise to Your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Your loving-pity come to me so I may live. For Your Law is my joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the proud be ashamed, because they do wrong to me for no reason, but I will think about Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: May those who fear You and those who know Your Law turn to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my heart be without blame in Your Law. Do not let me be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul becomes weak with desire for Your saving power, but I have put my hope in Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes become weak with desire for Your Word. I say, “When will You comfort me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: I have become like a wineskin in the smoke, but I do not forget Your Law.
