speaker: Narrator

text: How long must Your servant wait? When will You punish those who make it hard for me?
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have dug deep holes for me. They do not obey Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of Your Word is faithful. Help me! For they have made it hard for me with a lie.
speaker: Narrator

text: They almost destroyed me on the earth, but I did not turn away from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me life again by Your loving-kindness, and I will keep the Word of Your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forever, O Lord, Your Word will never change in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are faithful to all people for all time. You have made the earth, and it stands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stand today by Your Law, for all things serve You.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would have been lost in my troubles if Your Law had not been my joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will never forget Your Word for by it You have given me new life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am Yours. Save me, for I have looked to Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful wait to destroy me, but I will think about Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen that all things have an end, even if they are perfect, but Your Word is without end.
speaker: Narrator

text: O, how I love Your Law! It is what I think about all through the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Word makes me wiser than those who hate me, for it is always with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have better understanding than all my teachers because I think about Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have a better understanding than those who are old because I obey Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have kept my feet from every sinful way so that I may keep Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not turned away from Your Law, for You Yourself have taught me.
speaker: Narrator

text: How sweet is Your Word to my taste! It is sweeter than honey to my mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text: I get understanding from Your Law and so I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have promised that I will keep Your Law. And I will add strength to this promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am in much suffering. O Lord, give me life again by Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take my willing gift of thanks, O Lord, and teach me Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: My life is always in my hand, yet I do not forget Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinful have set a trap for me, yet I have not turned from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been given Your Law forever. It is the joy of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have set my heart on obeying Your Law forever, even to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate those who have two ways of thinking, but I love Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are my hiding place and my battle-covering. I put my hope in Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go away from me, you who do wrong, so I may keep the Word of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hold me up by Your Word and I will live. Do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hold me up so I will be safe, and I will always have respect for Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: You turn away from all those who turn from Your Law. They fool themselves with their own lying.
speaker: Narrator

text: You put away like waste all the sinful of the earth, so I love Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: My flesh shakes in fear of You, and I am afraid of how You may punish.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have done what is fair and right. Do not leave me to those who would make it hard for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Promise that You will bring good to Your servant. Do not let the proud make it hard for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes become weak with desire for Your saving power and for Your Word that is right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Act in Your loving-kindness toward Your servant, and teach me Your Laws.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am Your servant. Give me understanding so I may know Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is time for You to work, Lord, for they have broken Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love Your Word more than gold, more than pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so I look upon all of Your Law as right. I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Laws are wonderful, and so I obey them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The opening up of Your Word gives light. It gives understanding to the child-like.
speaker: Narrator

text: I opened my mouth wide, breathing with desire for Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn to me and show me loving-favor, as You always do to those who love Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set my steps in Your Word. Do not let sin rule over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set me free from the power of man, and I will obey Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make Your face shine upon Your servant and teach me Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tears flow from my eyes because of those who do not keep Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are right and good, O Lord, and Your Law is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Law You have made is right and good and very faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: I feel weak because those who hate me have forgotten Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Word is very pure and Your servant loves it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not important and I am hated but I do not forget Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are right forever, and Your Law is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trouble and suffering have come upon me, yet Your Word is my joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your Law is right forever. Give me understanding and I will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried with all my heart. Answer me, O Lord! I will keep Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried to You. Save me, and I will keep Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I rise before the morning comes and cry for help. I have put my hope in Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: My eyes wait for the night hours, so I may think about Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my voice because of Your loving-kindness. O Lord, give me new life again because of Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who follow sinful ways come near. But they are far from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are near, O Lord. And all of Your Word is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I learned from Your Law long ago that You made it to last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon my suffering and take me from it. For I do not forget Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand by me and set me free. Give me life again because of Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your saving help is far from the sinful, for they do not look to Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your loving-kindness is great, O Lord. Give me life again because of Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are many who hate me and make it hard for me. Yet I do not turn from Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I look with hate on those who cannot be trusted, because they do not keep Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Think about how I love Your Law. Give me life again, O Lord, because of Your loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of Your Word is truth, and every one of Your laws, which are always right, will last forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rulers make it hard for me for no reason, but my heart honors Your Words with fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am made happy by Your Word, like one who finds great riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate what is false, but I love Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I praise You seven times a day, because Your Law is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who love Your Law have great peace, and nothing will cause them to be hurt in their spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hope for Your saving power, O Lord, and I follow Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I obey Your Law, for I love it very much.
speaker: Narrator

text: I obey Your Word and Laws, for You know all my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my cry come to You, O Lord. Give me understanding because of Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my prayer come to You. Help me because of Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: May praise come from my lips, for You teach me Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: May my tongue sing about Your Word, for all of Your Word is right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: May Your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen Your Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have much desire for Your saving power, O Lord. Your Law is my joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me live so I may praise You, and let Your Law help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have gone from the way like a lost sheep. Look for Your servant, for I do not forget Your Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried to the Lord in my trouble, and He answered me.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, save me from lying lips and a false tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: What will be given to you and what more will be done to you, you false tongue?
speaker: Narrator

text: He will punish you with sharp arrows of the soldier, and with the hot fire of the broom tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is bad for me, for I travel in Meshech and live among the tents of Kedar!
speaker: Narrator

text: I have lived too long with those who hate peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am for peace. But when I speak, they are for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will lift up my eyes to the mountains. Where will my help come from?
speaker: Narrator

text: My help comes from the Lord, Who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not let your feet go out from under you. He Who watches over you will not sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen, He Who watches over Israel will not close his eyes or sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord watches over you. The Lord is your safe cover at your right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun will not hurt you during the day and the moon will not hurt you during the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will keep you from all that is sinful. He will watch over your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will watch over your coming and going, now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was glad when they said to me, “Let us go to the house of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Our feet are standing inside your gates, O Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerusalem is built as a city where people come together.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is where the different families go, the families of the Lord. There they give thanks to the name of the Lord, by the Law that was given to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thrones were set there for telling who is guilty or not, the thrones of the house of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem. May all go well for those who love you.
speaker: Narrator

text: May there be peace within your walls. May all go well within your houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will now say, “May peace be within you,” for the good of my brothers and my friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the house of the Lord our God, I will pray for your good.
speaker: Narrator

text: I lift up my eyes to You, O You Whose throne is in the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, the eyes of servants look to the hand of their owner. The eyes of a woman servant look to the hand of her owner. So our eyes look to the Lord our God, until He shows us loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show loving-kindness to us, O Lord. Show loving-kindness to us. For we have had our fill of hate.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have laughed at us too long. We have had more than enough of their hate.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If the Lord had not been on our side,” let Israel say,
speaker: Narrator

text: “If the Lord had not been on our side when men came against us,
speaker: Narrator

text: they would have eaten us up alive. Because their anger burned against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters would have covered us. The river would have passed over our soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angry waters would have passed over our soul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and thanks be to the Lord! He has not let us be torn by their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have become free like a bird out of a trap. The net is broken and now we are free.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our help is in the name of the Lord, Who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved but stands forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is around His people like the mountains are around Jerusalem, now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sinful will not rule over the land of those who are right with God. So those who are right and good may not use their hands to do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, do good to those who are good, and to those who are right in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord will let all those who turn aside to their sinful ways go with those who are sinners. Peace be upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was like a dream when the Lord brought back to Zion those who had been held in another land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we laughed with our mouths, and we sang with our tongues. Then it was said among the nations, “The Lord has done great things for them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has done great things for us and we are glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring back our people, O Lord, like the rivers in the South.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who plant with tears will gather fruit with songs of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who goes out crying as he carries his bag of seed will return with songs of joy as he brings much grain with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unless the Lord builds the house, its builders work for nothing. Unless the Lord watches over the city, the men who watch over it stay awake for nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: You rise up early, and go to bed late, and work hard for your food, all for nothing. For the Lord gives to His loved ones even while they sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, children are a gift from the Lord. The children born to us are our special reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of a young man are like arrows in the hand of a soldier.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is the man who has many of them. They will not be put to shame when they speak in the gate with those who hate them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are all who honor the Lord with fear, and who walk in His ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you will eat the fruit of your hands. You will be happy and it will be well with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your wife will be like a vine with much fruit within your house. Your children will be like olive plants around your table.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the good that will come to the man who honors the Lord with fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord do good things for you from Zion. And may you see good come to Jerusalem all the days of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, may you see your children’s children. Peace be upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “They have made it hard for me many times since I was young,” let Israel now say.
speaker: Narrator

text: “They have made it hard for me many times since I was young. But they have not won over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who plow have plowed my back. And they have made their ditches long.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is right and good. He has cut in two the ropes of the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: May all who hate Zion be put to shame and turned away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be like grass on the roof, which dries up before it grows.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one can pick it and fill his hand. No one can gather it and fill his arms.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who pass by do not say, “May the Lord be good to you. We pray that good will come to you in the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, I have cried to You out of the deep places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, hear my voice! Let Your ears hear the voice of my prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you, Lord, should write down our sins, O Lord, who could stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: But You are the One Who forgives, so You are honored with fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: I wait for the Lord. My soul waits and I hope in His Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul waits for the Lord more than one who watches for the morning; yes, more than one who watches for the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Israel, hope in the Lord! For there is loving-kindness with the Lord. With Him we are saved for sure.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He will save Israel from all their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, my heart is not proud. My eyes are not filled with pride. And I do not trouble myself with important things or in things too great for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure I have made my soul quiet like a child who no longer nurses while he is with his mother. My soul within me is like a child who no longer nurses.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Israel, hope in the Lord, now and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, remember David and all of his suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember how he swore to the Lord, and how he made a promise to the Powerful One of Jacob:
speaker: Narrator

text: “For sure I will not go into my house or lie on my bed,
speaker: Narrator

text: or let sleep come and close my eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: until I find a place for the Lord, a house of worship for the Powerful One of Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator

text: See, we heard about it in Ephrathah. We found it in the field of Jaar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us go into the House of God. Let us worship at His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, O Lord. Go to the place where You can rest, You and the special box of the Way of Worship which is Your strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Your religious leaders be dressed with what is right and good. And let those who belong to You sing for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of David Your servant, do not turn away from Your chosen one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has made a sure promise to David that He will never break: “I will set upon your throne your own children.
speaker: Narrator

text: If your sons will keep My Law and My Word which I will teach them, then their sons will sit upon your throne forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord has chosen Zion. He has wanted it for a place to live:
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the place where I can rest forever. Here I will live, for I have wanted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give her many good things. I will give her poor people much bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will dress her religious leaders with saving power. And those in her that belong to Me will sing for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: There I will make the horn of David grow and will make a lamp ready for My chosen one.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will dress those who hate him with shame. But the crown on him will shine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: See, how good and how pleasing it is for brothers to live together as one!
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like oil of great worth poured on the head, flowing down through the hair on the face, even the face of Aaron, and flowing down to his coat.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like the morning water of Hermon coming down upon the hills of Zion. For there the Lord has given the gift of life that lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, give honor and thanks to the Lord, all who work for the Lord, who stand during the night in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your hands to the holy place and give thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord bring good to you from Zion. He is the One Who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord! Praise Him, O servants of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: you who stand in the house of the Lord, within the walls of the house of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good. Sing praises to His name, for it is sweet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for Himself. Israel belongs to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that the Lord is great. He is greater than all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord does whatever is pleasing to Him, in heaven and on earth, in the seas and in all waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes the clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning come with the rain. He brings the wind out from where He stores His riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed the first-born of Egypt, both man and animal.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent special things to see and did great works among you, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: He crushed many nations and killed powerful kings,
speaker: Narrator

text: King Sihon of the Amorites, King Og of Bashan, and all the kings of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He gave their land as a gift, a gift to Israel His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, Your name lasts forever. O Lord, You will be remembered for all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord will decide in favor of His people. He will have loving-pity on His servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gods of the nations are silver and gold, made by the hands of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have mouths but they do not speak. They have eyes but they do not see.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have ears but they do not hear. And there is no breath in their mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who make them and those who trust in them will be like them.
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Israel, give honor and thanks to the Lord. O house of Aaron, give honor and thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Levi, give honor and thanks to the Lord. You who fear the Lord, give honor and thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor and thanks be to the Lord from Zion, Who lives in Jerusalem. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to the God of gods, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who alone does great works, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who by wisdom made the heavens, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who spread out the earth upon the waters, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who made the great lights, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the sun to rule during the day, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the moon and stars to rule during the night, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who killed the first-born of Egypt, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought Israel out from among them, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put out His arm and brought them out with a strong hand, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who divided the Red Sea in two, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He led Israel through, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He caused the death of Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who led His people through the desert, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who destroyed great kings, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed powerful kings, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put to death Sihon, king of the Amorites, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put to death Og, king of Bashan, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave their land as a gift, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave it as a gift to Israel His servant, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to Him Who remembered us when we had nothing, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took us away from those who hated us, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives food to all men, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give thanks to the God of heaven, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: We sat down and cried by the rivers of Babylon when we remembered Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: There upon the trees we put our harps.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who held us there made us sing. And those who made it hard for us asked for joy. They said, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
speaker: Narrator

text: How can we sing the song of the Lord in a strange land?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, may my right hand forget what it is able to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: May my tongue hold to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not honor Jerusalem above my highest joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, remember what the sons of Edom did on the day Jerusalem fell. “Knock it down,” they said, “Knock it down to the ground.”
speaker: Narrator

text: O daughter of Babylon, you who will be destroyed, how honored will be the one who pays you back for what you have done to us!
speaker: Narrator

text: How honored will be the one who catches your children and throws them against the rock!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give You thanks with all my heart. I will sing praises to You in front of the gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bow down toward Your holy house. And I will give thanks to Your name for Your loving-kindness and Your truth. For You have honored Your Word because of what Your name is.
speaker: Narrator

text: You answered me on the day I called. You gave me strength in my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, all the kings of the earth will give thanks to You when they have heard the words of Your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will sing of the ways of the Lord. For the shining beauty of the Lord is great.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even if the Lord is honored, He thinks about those who have no pride. But He knows the proud from far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even if I walk into trouble, You will keep my life safe. You will put out Your hand against the anger of those who hate me. And Your right hand will save me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will finish the work He started for me. O Lord, Your loving-kindness lasts forever. Do not turn away from the works of Your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, You have looked through me and have known me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know when I sit down and when I get up. You understand my thoughts from far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: You look over my path and my lying down. You know all my ways very well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even before I speak a word, O Lord, You know it all.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have closed me in from behind and in front. And You have laid Your hand upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: All You know is too great for me. It is too much for me to understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where can I go from Your Spirit? Or where can I run away from where You are?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I go up to heaven, You are there! If I make my bed in the place of the dead, You are there!
speaker: Narrator

text: If I take the wings of the morning or live in the farthest part of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: even there Your hand will lead me and Your right hand will hold me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I say, “For sure the darkness will cover me and the light around me will be night,”
speaker: Narrator

text: even the darkness is not dark to You. And the night is as bright as the day. Darkness and light are the same to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: For You made the parts inside me. You put me together inside my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give thanks to You, for the greatness of the way I was made brings fear. Your works are great and my soul knows it very well.
speaker: Narrator

text: My bones were not hidden from You when I was made in secret and put together with care in the deep part of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eyes saw me before I was put together. And all the days of my life were written in Your book before any of them came to be.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your thoughts are of great worth to me, O God. How many there are!
speaker: Narrator

text: If I could number them, there would be more than the sand. When I awake, I am still with You.
speaker: Narrator

text: If only You would kill the sinful, O God, and the men of blood would go away from me!
speaker: Narrator

text: For they speak against You in sin. Those who hate You use Your name in a wrong way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do I not hate those who hate You, O Lord? And do I not hate those who rise up against You?
speaker: Narrator

text: I hate them with the strongest hate. They have become men who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look through me, O God, and know my heart. Try me and know my thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text: See if there is any sinful way in me and lead me in the way that lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, take me away from sinful men. Keep me safe from men who want to hurt others.
speaker: Narrator

text: They make sinful plans in their hearts. They always start wars.
speaker: Narrator

text: They make their tongues sharp like a snake’s. And the poison of a snake is under their lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, keep me from the hands of the sinful. Keep me safe from men who want to hurt others and have planned to trip my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: The proud have hidden a trap for me. With ropes they have spread a net. They have set traps for me beside the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said to the Lord, “You are my God. Listen to the voice of my prayers, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O God the Lord, the strength that saves me, You have covered my head in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, do not give the sinful what they want. Do not let their plans work, or they will be honored.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for those who gather around me, may the wrong-doing of their lips come upon their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: May burning coals fall upon them. May they be thrown into the fire, into deep holes, and rise no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let the man whose talking hurts people stand in the land. May trouble hurry to catch and destroy the man who wants to hurt others.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that the Lord will stand by those who suffer and do what is right for the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sure those who are right and good will give thanks to Your name. Those who are right will live with You.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call upon You, O Lord. Hurry to me! Hear my voice when I call to You!
speaker: Narrator

text: May my prayer be like special perfume before You. May the lifting up of my hands be like the evening gift given on the altar in worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, put a watch over my mouth. Keep watch over the door of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let my heart turn to any sinful thing, to do wrong with men who sin. And do not let me eat their fine food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who are right with God punish me and speak strong words to me in kindness. It is oil upon my head. Do not let my head turn away from it. Yet my prayer is always against the sinful works of those who sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: When their rulers are thrown down from high rocks, they will hear my words, for they are true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our bones have been spread around the mouth of the grave like the broken ground behind the plow.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my eyes are toward You, O God the Lord. In You I have a safe place. Do not leave me without help.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep me from the trap they have set for me. Keep me from the nets of those who do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the sinful fall into their own nets, while I pass by and am safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cry with a loud voice to the Lord. I pray with my voice to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I talk and complain to Him. I tell Him all my trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my spirit had grown weak within me, You knew my path. They have hidden a trap for me in the way where I walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look to the right and see. For there is no one who thinks about me. There is no place for me to go to be safe. No one cares about my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: I cried out to You, O Lord. I said, “You are my safe place, my share in the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen to my cry, for I am brought down. Save me from those who make it hard for me. For they are too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring my soul out of prison, so that I may give thanks to Your name. Those who are right and good will gather around me. For You will give much to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear my prayer, O Lord. Listen when I ask for help. Answer me because You are faithful and right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not find Your servant guilty, for no man living is right and good in Your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the one who hates me has made it hard for my soul. He has crushed my life to the ground. He has made me live in dark places, like those who have been dead for a long time.
speaker: Narrator

text: So my spirit grows weak within me. My heart within me is afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remember the days long ago. I think about all You have done. I think about the work of Your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I put out my hands to You. My soul is thirsty for You like a dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hurry to answer me, O Lord! My spirit is becoming weak! Do not hide Your face from me, or I will become like those who go down to the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me hear Your loving-kindness in the morning, for I trust in You. Teach me the way I should go for I lift up my soul to You.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, take me away from those who hate me. I run to You to be safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God. Let Your good Spirit lead me on a straight path.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me new life, O Lord, because of Your name. Bring me out of trouble because You are right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Your loving-kindness cut off those who hate me. Destroy all those who make it hard for my soul, for I am Your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise and thanks be to the Lord, my rock. He makes my hands ready for war, and my fingers for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is my loving-kindness and my walls of strength, my strong place and the One Who sets me free, my safe-covering and the One in Whom I trust. He brings my people under my rule.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, what is man that You think of him, the son of man that You remember him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Man is like a breath. His days are like a passing shadow.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, divide Your heavens and come down. Touch the mountains so they will smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send out lightning and divide them. Send out Your arrows and trouble them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put out Your hand from above. Take me out of trouble and away from the many waters, from the power of those from other lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their mouths speak lies. And their right hand is a right hand that is false.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sing a new song to You, O God. I will sing praises to You on a harp of ten strings.
speaker: Narrator

text: You save kings. You take Your servant David away from the sharp sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take me out of trouble and away from the power of those from other lands. Their mouths speak lies. And their right hand is a right hand that is false.
speaker: Narrator

text: May our young sons be like plants that are full-grown. And may our daughters be like the corner pieces of a great house.
speaker: Narrator

text: May our store-houses be full of all kinds of food. And may our sheep grow by the thousands and ten thousands in our fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let our cattle give birth without trouble and without loss. And may there be no cry of trouble in our streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are the people who have all this. Yes, happy are the people whose God is the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise You, my God and King. I will honor Your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will honor You every day, and praise Your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is great and our praise to Him should be great. He is too great for anyone to understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Families of this time will praise Your works to the families-to-come. They will tell about Your powerful acts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will think about the shining-greatness of Your power and about Your great works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Men will speak of Your powerful acts that fill us with fear. And I will tell of Your greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many words will come from their mouths about how good You are. They will sing for joy about how right You are.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is full of loving-favor and pity, slow to anger and great in loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is good to all. And His loving-kindness is over all His works.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Your works will give thanks to You, O Lord. And all those who belong to You will honor You.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will speak of the shining-greatness of Your holy nation, and talk of Your power.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will make Your powerful acts and the great power of Your holy nation known to the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your holy nation is a nation that lasts forever. And Your rule lasts for all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord holds up all who fall. He raises up all who are brought down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of all look to You. And You give them their food at the right time.
speaker: Narrator

text: You open Your hand and fill the desire of every living thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is right and good in all His ways, and kind in all His works.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is near to all who call on Him, to all who call on Him in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will fill the desire of those who fear Him. He will also hear their cry and will save them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord takes care of all who love Him. But He will destroy all the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord. And all flesh will honor His holy name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord, O my soul!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will praise the Lord as long as I live. I will sing praises to my God as long as I live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not put your trust in princes, in a son of a man, who cannot save us.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his spirit leaves, he returns to the earth. His thoughts end on that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy is he whose help is the God of Jacob, and whose hope is in the Lord his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord made heaven and earth, the sea and all that is in them. He is faithful forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He helps those who have a bad power over them. He gives food to the hungry. And He sets those in prison free.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord opens the eyes of the blind. The Lord raises up those who are brought down. The Lord loves those who are right and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord keeps the strangers safe. He takes care of the children who have no father and the woman whose husband has died. But He destroys the way of the sinful.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will rule forever. Your God, O Zion, will rule over all people for all time. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! For it is good to sing praises to our God. For it is pleasing and praise is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord builds up Jerusalem. He gathers those of Israel who had been taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: He heals those who have a broken heart. He heals their sorrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: He knows the number of the stars. He gives names to all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great is our Lord, and great in power. His understanding has no end.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord lifts up those who are suffering, and He brings the sinful down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing to the Lord with thanks. Sing praises to our God on the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: He covers the heavens with clouds. He gives rain for the earth. He makes grass grow on the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives food to the animals, and to the young ravens that cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: His joy is not in the strength of a horse. He does not find joy in the legs of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord favors those who fear Him and those who wait for His loving-kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text: For He has made your gates strong. He has made good come to your children within you.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes peace within your walls. He fills you with the best grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sends His Word to the earth. And His Word runs fast.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives snow like wool. He spreads ice like ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He throws down His ice as hail stones. Who can stand before His cold?
speaker: Narrator

text: He sends out His Word and melts them. He makes His wind blow and the waters flow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He speaks His Word to Jacob, and His Law to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has not done this with any other nation. They do not know His Law. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord from the heavens! Praise Him on high!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him, all His angels! Praise Him, all His army!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him, sun and moon! Praise Him, all you shining stars!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him, you highest heavens, and you waters above the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise the name of the Lord! For He spoke and they came into being.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has made them last forever and ever. He has set a Law which will not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord from the earth, you large sea animals and all seas,
speaker: Narrator

text: fire and hail, snow and clouds, and wind storms, obeying His Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord, you mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all tall trees,
speaker: Narrator

text: wild animals and all cattle, small animals that move on the ground and birds that fly,
speaker: Narrator

text: kings of the earth and all people, princes and all leaders of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: both young men and women who have never had men, and old men and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise the name of the Lord. For His name alone is honored. His shining-greatness is above earth and heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has raised up a horn for His people, praise for all who belong to Him, for the people of Israel, who are near to Him. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! Sing a new song to the Lord! Praise Him in the meeting of His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Israel be glad in his Maker. Let the sons of Zion be full of joy in their King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them praise His name with dancing. Let them sing praises to Him with timbrels and a harp.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is happy with His people. He saves those who have no pride and makes them beautiful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let those who are God-like be full of joy and honor. Let them sing for joy on their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and in their hand a sword that cuts both ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let it be used to punish the nations and the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their kings be tied in chains, and their rulers with ropes of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the punishment that is written be given to them. This is an honor for all His faithful ones. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise the Lord! Praise God in His holy place! Praise Him in the heavens of His power!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him for His great works! Praise Him for all His greatness!
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him with the sound of a horn. Praise Him with harps.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him with timbrels and dancing. Praise Him with strings and horns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Praise Him with loud sounds. Praise Him with loud and clear sounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator
